3095.name: End of the World
3095.storyline: When Owen is at the security station at the mental ward, there is a b & w clip on the monitor which appears to be Jack Nicholson in "One Flew Over the cuckoos Nest".

3096.name: Mission Stardust
3096.storyline: Opened in Rome in August 1967 under the title "4... 3... 2... 1... morte" with a running time of 95 minutes. It was later released in West Germany in October 1967 under the title "Perry Rhodan--SOS aus dem Weltall" with a 79-minute running time. It was later released in Spain as "rbita mortal" with a 92-minute running time. It opened in Los Angeles in October 1968.

3097.name: Being Leonardo Da Vinci
3097.storyline: I've watched the movie recently during a screening at UCLA and I was impressed by the care of the details. The part of the interview, where the language is taken from the original Leonardo's manuscripts, is worthy to be seen over and over

3098.name: The Black Sleep
3098.storyline: Shot February 9-23 1956, and the last completed film project of actor Bela Lugosi.

3099.name: Jurassic Predator: Xtinction
3099.storyline: At 46:24 the old rotary telephone has the number 504-455-7450. Unlike most phone numbers on TV and films which show the local number 555-xxxx, this is an actual live number listed for Raymond J. McCabe on AT&T Southwest in New Orleans, LA according to the app Online Reverse Lookup .

3102.name: City in the Sea
3102.storyline: The destruction of the underwater city utilized stock footage from Atragon (1963).

3103.name: Killer Witches from Outer Space
3103.storyline: The title is a homage to Killer Klowns from Outer Space (1988)

3104.name: Thunderbirds Are GO
3104.storyline: The first feature film to be shot using the Livingston Electronic Viewfinder Unit, also known as Add-a-Vision. This was basically an electronic viewfinder that could be used in conjunction with a Mitchell BNC Camera to take a television picture directly from the camera, enabling the staff of the entire unit to watch any scene being filmed on the television monitors. This also allowed the puppeteers to better control their puppets and keep them on their marks in the frame.

3105.name: Return of the Fly
3105.storyline: Vincent Price signed on for the film after reading the first draft of its script; however, the studio demanded re-writes in order to reduce production costs. The re-writes reportedly removed much of what Price liked about the film's first draft.

3106.name: We Are Not Alone
3106.storyline: UKTV have confirmed that they have no plans to take the alien invasion comedy to series. In interviews co-creators Laurence Rickard and Ben Willbond stated that the two-hour special, first broadcast in November 2022, was deemed as a trial episode for a prospective series, with Willbond saying: "It's a feature-length pilot. We're keeping our fingers crossed that Dave commission a series."

3108.name: Sapphire Blue
3108.storyline: Although the dialogue is spoken in German, French, and Latin, the songs are sung in English and the writing is also in English.

3110.name: Pokmon the Movie: Destiny Deoxys
3110.storyline: Deoxys's Speed Forme does not appear in this movie, as this movie was released before Pokmon Emerald; Speed Forme had yet to be introduced to the public.

3111.name: Sky Pirates
3111.storyline: The plane used in the movie now sits in the far north Queensland town of Kuranda. It was moved there after it was donated to a family for preservation. The plane was placed in amongst some rain forest vegetation and is slowly being overgrown. Photos can be found online as its a popular tourist attraction.

3113.name: Dimension 5
3113.storyline: Sixteen months before the movie's release, on June 28, 1965, the Pan Am Boeing 707 (registration: N761PA) that Jeffrey Hunter is seen leaving from during the opening credits had an engine explode just after taking off from San Francisco. The uncontained engine explosion caused a fire, a fuel tank explosion and one wing partially separated. The plane made an emergency landing at Travis Air Force Base and there were no injuries.

3114.name: Comic Relief: Doctor Who - The Curse of Fatal Death
3114.storyline: Rowan Atkinson had actually been a serious contender for role of The Doctor in the regular TV series.

3115.name: Doraemon: Great Adventure in the Antarctic Kachi Kochi
3115.storyline: This is the fastest film of Doraemon to reach 4 billion milestone within 37 days of release.

3116.storyline: This is for the first time that Sony Pictures produces movies in Indian regional films

3117.name: Parasyte: Part 2
3117.storyline: In Spain was only released in cinemas in Madrid (Artistic Metropol). The film was projected for 2 days in subtitled version.

3118.name: The Time Machine
3118.storyline: Some of the sound effects used in the time-travel sequences are the same as those used in the TV series The Time Tunnel (1966) and the feature film The Time Machine (1960).

3119.name: A.P.E.X.
3119.storyline: The 12-wheeled vehicle used in the film was created by Jefferies Automotive in Universal City, California. Only one was built at a cost of $300,000 in 1976. The Landmaster is powered by a 391 cubic-inch Ford industrial engine, and features a fully-functional, custom-built "tristar" wheel arrangement, which could actually help it "crawl" over boulders. It also used an innovative steering mechanism that guided the vehicle, not by the front wheels, but by "bending" the middle section with hydraulic rams to effect a turn. The Landmaster's bodywork was made with 3/8-inch steel plating, which helped it tip the scales at over 10 tons. It was so tough, in fact, that it survived a 25-foot jump during testing with no damage. As of today, the original "Landmaster" is alive and well, and is currently in the hands of a private collector who purchased it in 2005. It has been restored to its original condition as seen in the film.

3120.name: Turks in Space
3120.storyline: Featured in David Walliams' Awfully Good: Awfully Good Movies (2011)

3121.name: Rise of the Black Bat
3121.storyline: The character of the Black Bat is based on the golden age pulp character who came out the same month as the first appearance of Batman. The Black Bat's origin was "borrowed" and used as the basis for Two-Face and Daredevil.

3122.name: Firelight
3122.storyline: Steven Spielberg later remade the film as Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977).

3123.name: Voyage to the Planet of Prehistoric Women
3123.storyline: Director "Derek Thomas" is actually Peter Bogdanovich.

3124.name: Outpost: Black Sun
3124.storyline: The plot takes place in Backa Palanka, a town in the northern part of Serbia, near the Serbian-Croatian border.

3125.name: Man Vs.
3125.storyline: Filmed in the style of the documentary series "Survivorman" with Canadian survivalist Les Stroud. The premise is nearly identical; Les is dropped in foreboding areas with only a small backpack of seemingly random objects. Les then utilizes what is left with him, instructing the viewer along the way, on survival techniques. Man Vs Wild alternates in POV (Point of View) and static shots with a video camera on either a tripod or the ground, and cameras mounted to selfie sticks or mounted to his person. One specific similarity between the movie and its apparent inspiration is the scene in which the lead character starts a fire with a polished soda can; its a technique Stroud successfully demonstrated in his series.

3126.name: Autumn
3126.storyline: The writing on the blackboard changes significantly between shots, around the 3:43 mark. What appears to be the phrase "Dead Kids" written in cursive disappears in the next shot.

3127.name: The Wasp Woman
3127.storyline: In a 1992 interview, Fred Olen Ray said he asked Roger Corman if he could remake Corman's movie The Wasp Woman (1959), but Corman had no interest. So Ray took the concept to another company, changed wasp enzymes to alien, and called it Evil Spawn (1987). Jim Wynorski later convinced Corman to remake The Wasp Woman.

3128.name: The Omega Code
3128.storyline: The room in which a computer is used to "decode" the Bible was the only set built specifically for this film. The rest of the scenes were shot on a variety of locations around the world.

3129.name: Cold Ground
3129.storyline: The 1969 album cover [screaming face], left of The Allman Brothers Band album cover, seen during the opening credits, is titled "In the Court of the Crimson King" by King Crimson.

3130.name: Gamera vs. Viras
3130.storyline: This was the first film in the series to use flashbacks from the previous Gamera films as a way of saving money on the production. In this film, the flashback sequence lasts approximately fifteen minutes.

3131.name: To the Solitary Me Who Loved You
3131.storyline: This film and its parallel tale To Every You I've Loved Before (2022), both about parallel worlds, share the same release date of October 7 2022Similarly, Yomoji Otono's novel adaptations of "Kimi o Aishita Hitori no Boku e" and "Boku ga Aishita Subete no Kimi e" released on the same date of June 23 2016.

3132.name: The Unborn
3132.storyline: Gary Numan did the soundtrack for this movie. Music can be found on Gary's 'human' cd.some of these later became songs on Gary Numan's next album 'outland'in 1991.

3133.name: Wild Zero
3133.storyline: Filmed in Thailand. The main cast is Japanese, with the exception of "Tobio" who is played by a Thai actor, but voice dubbed by a Japanese actress. The extras (mostly zombies) are Thai.

3134.name: Alien Private Eye
3134.storyline: The highly addictive drug in the film is called Soma, which is the same name for the drug featured prominently in Aldous Huxley's 1932 novel "Brave New World".

3135.name: Wings of Honneamise
3135.storyline: Briefly held the record for the largest production budget ($8 million) for any anime, until Akira (1988) was produced at a budget of $10 million in 1988.

3136.name: The Return
3136.storyline: Cybill Shepherd recalled in her autobiography "Cybill Disobedience" (2000) that it was "not quite the worst movie ever made but close" and that the cast were "a rather sad group of actors, all trying to resurrect our diminished careers. [Raymond Burr] read his lines off a TelePrompter."

3137.name: Shanghai Fortress
3137.storyline: While at the bar, a large neon sign outside misspells "catastrophe" with "catastrophy".

3138.name: Three Inches
3138.storyline: Filmed as a pilot for a potential TV show on SyFy but the show never happened.

3140.name: Ghost in the Shell: SAC_2045 - Sustainable War
3140.storyline: We've rounded up every anime series and movie we could find  created or distributed by Netflix  to see which ones rank the highest, according to IMDb users.

3141.name: Winx Club: The Secret of the Lost Kingdom
3141.storyline: This movie was originally intended to be the finale of the show.

3142.name: Attack
3142.storyline: The film pays tribute to the real person Nathan Copeland. Who is one of the first people to have a brain interface.

3143.name: High Moon
3143.storyline: The TV movie's title "High Moon" is based on the novel by John Christopher, "The Lotus Caves," from 1969.

3144.name: Amazing Stories
3144.storyline: A television film edited from three episodes of Amazing Stories (1985): The Mission (1985), Mummy Daddy (1985) and Go to the Head of the Class (1986).

3145.name: Dinoshark
3145.storyline: One of the few films produced by Roger Corman that does not feature female nudity.

3146.name: Heat Vision and Jack
3146.storyline: Ron Silver almost turned the project down because he was busy with Veronica's Closet (1997). But he liked the script so much he made time in his schedule.

3147.name: Endgame - Bronx lotta finale
3147.storyline: Of all his movies, director Joe D'Amato has stated that he likes this one best.

3148.name: Red Mist
3148.storyline: Although the film is set in America, Arielle Kebbel is the only American actor in the cast.

3149.name: Higher Power
3149.storyline: Based off the story of DC's Dr. Manhattan.

3150.name: Hibernatus
3150.storyline: Original source: "Hibernatus", comedy by Jean-Bernard Luc which opened on 26-1-1957 at the Thtre de l'Athne, starring Pierre Mondy.

3152.name: Curse of the Black Widow
3152.storyline: In a 2013 interview with the Television Academy, Patty Duke admitted that money was her only motivation for appearing in this film. Duke did not like the final product, but her kids enjoyed it and she did enjoy working on the film.

3153.name: Don't F**k with Ghosts
3153.storyline: I went in just to support one of the crew members, and wasn't really expecting much.But it was unexpectedly good quality basically from the beginning. Both the script and the acting were really good.It gave me the same feeling as "half-baked" the first time I saw it. Like "really? Are we going THERE???"The scene with the mushroom tea was EPIC, definitely took me by surprise. It was a fantastic diversion from the usual scary movie plots.The local paranormal experts also made the film very believable and gave me the final buy in.I know the other people in the theatre liked it too cause we were all laughing at the same punchlines.The final scene, which I won't give away, was a real surprise, and extremely unexpected. I'm going to watch it again on Thursday because I did get the 10 minutes late and I wana make sure I see the whole thing.If you watch it, make sure to stay for the credits. TONS of laughs in the added scenes there.This has all the hallmarks of a potential cult classic!!!Well done 5'7 films.

3154.name: Iceman
3154.storyline: Lead actor and action director Donnie Yen said that a seven-minute fight scene took ten days to shoot.

3155.name: Salt and Fire
3155.storyline: Werner Herzog: One of the passengers on the plane near the beginning of the film.

3156.name: The Bubble
3156.storyline: Originally released with a running time of 112 minutes but several critics complained about the slow pacing so, in 1968, director Arch Oboler cut it to 91 minutes. Unfortunately, the edits were made directly to the original camera negative and the footage was discarded. It was thought to be lost until a personal copy of the original print belonging to Deborah Walley was located. The 2014 Kino Lorber blu-ray retains the original title & 3-D but is still the 91 minute edit of the film.

3157.name: America Is Sinking
3157.storyline: Daniella and Kimmy are in a car heading uphill on a paved road when they run out of gas and have to stop, the paved road ahead of them quite visible. They get out of the car on a gravel road sloping downward.

3158.name: Synchronicity
3158.storyline: When Jim goes to Abby's apartment for the first time, you can read on the intercom :"Sebastian, J.F. #2019". J.F. Sebastian is a character from Blade Runner (1982), set in 2019, and directed by Ridley Scott. Just above is "Scott, Anthony #2012". Anthony Scott, aka Tony Scott, director known for Top Gun (1986), Spy Game (2001) and Crimson Tide (1995), among others, died in 2012 and was Ridley's younger brother.

3160.name: Last Woman on Earth
3160.storyline: It was Roger Corman's practice when going on location to make the most of that location by shooting a second film. This film was made because Corman was in Puerto Rico to shoot Creature from the Haunted Sea (1961).

3162.name: Island Zero
3162.storyline: Aside from the four lead roles, almost all the other parts were cast with Maine actors - many of whom had never before appeared in a feature film.

3163.name: Attack of the Giant Leeches
3163.storyline: According to director Bernard L. Kowalski, producer Gene Corman didn't want to pay the grips the extra money for pushing the camera raft while they were filming in the Pasadena Arboretum in the water, so first Kowalski and his brother did it and later Corman put on a bathing suit and did it himself and ended up in a hospital for a few days.

3164.name: Sword Art Online: Progressive - Aria of a Starless Night
3164.storyline: The first animated film to be presented in IMAX since Disney's Fantasia 2000.

3165.name: Furia
3165.storyline: Based on Julio Cortzar's short story "Graffiti".

3166.name: Pokmon Heroes
3166.storyline: This is the first Pokemon movie where the Pokemon are given genders and referred as such by the characters.

3167.name: The Adventure of A.R.I.: My Robot Friend
3167.storyline: Sometimes you just got to accept the predictability for what you know the film is about.

3168.name: Progeny
3168.storyline: Actress Jillian McWhirter, who plays Sherry, said in interview how the scene where she gets raped by giant alien monster was shot but then due to some problems it had to be re-shot two different times. This is why the scene is so short in the movie. Originally the scene was meant to be longer, the alien monster was gonna try and calm Sherry down by fondling her nude body with its tentacles while holding her (just like other aliens did in earlier scenes), and part where it rapes her was also gonna be longer and more graphic. Three still photos showing McWhirter filming the original version of the scene in different location than it happens in the movie and while covered with slime on top of giant alien monster puppet that was used in the scene did appear in Femme Fatales article about her.

3169.name: The Mole People
3169.storyline: Footage of the mole people was later used in The Wild World of Batwoman (1966) as monsters created by a super-villain.

3170.name: The Adventures of Mark Twain
3170.storyline: This is the first full-length feature in clay animation.

3171.name: A Journey to the Beginning of Time
3171.storyline: Most of the prehistoric animal reconstructions have been modeled after the artwork of renowned Czech painter Zdenek Burian. This is perhaps most apparent on the Brontosaurus, which is standing in almost the exact same pose as in Burian's famous piece and has the exact same detailing on its body. Strangely, the prominently-featured Stegosaurus and Ceratosaurus were not based on Burian's art, even though he has painted both animals, including the promotional paintings for this very film.

3172.name: The Man Who Could Cheat Death
3172.storyline: Hazel Court played the Anton Diffring sculpting scene topless. Only her bare back is shown in the British and U.S. versions, but her breasts are visible in the scene shot for European versions. It was one of the first nude scenes of its kind to be shot in England. They cleared the set and had just a skeleton crew. She said she agreed to do it because the scene warranted the nudity and it was shot beautifully. If had been gratuitous, she'd have refused.

3173.name: Mulberry St
3173.storyline: The cast was made up of friends and family of the filmmakers.

3176.name: Boonie Bears: Guardian Code
3176.storyline: It is among the Spring Festival movie lineup for 2023.

3177.name: Nazi Overlord
3177.storyline: The movie is being released on November 13th, 2018 to capitalize on the release of 'Overlord', which premieres on November the 9th.

3178.name: Alien vs. Ninja
3178.storyline: When the alien is about to jump on the woman ninja, he is jumping like he wants to land on his belly in one shot, in the other, he lands on his feet.

3179.name: Polaris
3179.storyline: When the blizzard is rising outside Dee's house, the snow is blasting one way, while her chimney smoke billows comfortably in the other.

3180.name: Dragon Ball: The Magic Begins
3180.storyline: The film was loosely inspired by Dragon Ball: Curse of the Blood Rubies (1986).

3181.name: Ice Quake
3181.storyline: The Boiling point of methane is -263.2F The coldest recorded temperature on Earth is -135F A flowing river of methane is physically impossible on this planet.

3182.name: Abbott and Costello Meet Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
3182.storyline: Boris Karloff only really played Dr. Jekyll in this film. Once the makeup transformation scenes were over, stuntman Eddie Parker did every scene as Mr. Hyde. This was even tipped off to audiences through publicity stills for the film, which showed both Karloff and Parker in makeup standing next to each other.

3183.name: Cyborg She
3183.storyline: "Cyborg She" is the final installment in Jae-young Kwak's "Sassy Girl Trilogy".

3184.name: Origin: Spirits of the Past
3184.storyline: The first feature-length theatrical film made by Studio Gonzo.

3185.name: Empires of the Deep
3185.storyline: Originally set to have its theatrical release in 2013.

3186.name: Approaching the Unknown
3186.storyline: Worsley (Charles Baker) and Greenstreet (Anders Danielsen Lie) (the crew of the refuelling station) are both named after members of the crew of Ernest Shackleton's ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1914-1917. They were the Captain and First Officer respectively, as they are in this film.

3187.name: Interceptor Force
3187.storyline: Featured on red letter media Best of the worst: Battle of the genres.

3188.name: And a Boy Shall Lead Them
3188.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

3189.name: The Underground
3189.storyline:
The movie shows parts of interviews
and news shows from the Russian propaganda tv channel RT. RT is nothing but a manipulative and lying Russian propaganda channel.

3190.name: Instant Dreams
3190.storyline: The voice that can be heard coming out of the photo printing machine in Tokyo is that of Werner Herzog.

3191.name: Terminus
3191.storyline: Even though the story allegedly takes place in the United States, many references to Australia are seen in the film, throwing the story off.Chrysler 300C driven by the government agents is right-hand-drive. As the agent exited the left side of Chrysler, the dashboard is briefly visible to have no steering wheel on the left side.The green-white pictogram for emergency exit sign is visible in the hospital. The American equivalent is red EXIT.The doorknobs are positioned close to the shoulder height: typical feature in Australia and New Zealand but never in the United States.The telephone at repair garage is Australian and never been available in the US.

3192.name: The Glitch
3192.storyline: After watching most sci-fi movies involving robots, humanoids, malfunctions, etc, I did not see what was coming here. A very well developed plot and story, so much that I ended up questioning things in society and contemporary problems. Actors are great. Scenography is great. It is not the type of movie that general audiences would like because... it's just not obvious. You have to watch it, think about it, feel it, imagine, reimagine, rethink and... it'll still not be clear if you're thinking it right. This is the type of movie that would not be a blockbuster because it's for those who are really into complex plots. Grade: 10 out of 10 for me.

3193.name: Forever Young
3193.storyline: Forever Young is a thought-provoking film that delves into the alluring fantasy of reversing the aging process. The story centers around 70-year-old Robyn, who embarks on a transformative journey after taking a formula that reverses aging. Her portrayal is deep and vulnerable, effectively capturing the emotional complexities of reliving life. The film excels in its subtle visual storytelling, focusing more on the human aspect than the science fiction, which enhances its emotional impact. The narrative's exploration of life choices and regrets is both reflective and resonant, encouraging viewers to contemplate their own decisions and life paths.The pacing can be uneven at times, and some plot points feel underdeveloped. While the film ambitiously tackles philosophical themes, these occasionally overshadow the personal story. Despite these flaws, its core message about the beauty of embracing life at every stage makes it a compelling watch. It's a film that not only entertains but also inspires introspection, making it a valuable experience for those who appreciate cinema that challenges and enlightens.

3194.name: Timestalkers
3194.storyline: Scott McKenzie's sports car is a 1986 Panther Kallista.

3195.name: Camel Spiders
3195.storyline: The actors cast to play American soldiers did a wardrobe change after lunch and then played the Taliban forces.

3196.name: Invasion, U.S.A.
3196.storyline: Noel Neill (Second Airline Ticket Agent) and Phyllis Coates (Mrs. Mulfory) both played Lois Lane: Neill in Superman (1948), Atom Man vs. Superman (1950) and Seasons Two to Six of Adventures of Superman (1952) and Coates in Superman and the Mole-Men (1951) and Season One of Adventures of Superman (1952).

3197.name: Dinosaurus!
3197.storyline: During special effects work on the film, the stop-motion animation crew used their brontosaurus model and miniature jungle set to film a shot for The Odyssey of Flight 33 (1961).

3198.name: Muse
3198.storyline: The actress Elle Evans is married to Matt Bellamy singer front man for the band "Muse" also the name of the film.

3199.name: The Astounding She-Monster
3199.storyline: During filming, Shirley Kilpatrick's costume ripped, and since the film was done on a low budget and on a tight schedule she couldn't get a new one - this is why she walks backwards as she leaves a room.

3202.name: Before We Vanish
3202.storyline: Amano: Can you keep a secret? We're invading Earth! Have I got your attention now?

3205.name: Beginning of the End
3205.storyline: The phone in Audrey's car is a precursor to modern cell phones. It worked off of the Mobile Telephone Service, a VHF service with very limited availability. The user would be connected to an operator, who would then route the call to a second operator that could then route the call to the intended recipient.

3206.name: Knights
3206.storyline: Was originally intended to be a sequel to Cyborg.

3207.name: The Cars That Ate Paris
3207.storyline: The opening scenes that feature a couple driving in a car and smoking prominently displaying cigarettes were a parody of a commercial aired on Australian television at the time of the film's original release. Website 'Peterweircave' says of this: "The opening "advertisement", which many viewers seem to take as blatant product placement for Coke and Alpine cigarettes, was actually a spoof in itself. At the time it was made, movies in Australia were often preceded by ads for cigarettes and such. By putting this before the opening credits, Weir was fooling the viewers into thinking this was yet another ad."

3208.name: Journey to the Seventh Planet
3208.storyline: It was noted that certain plot elements bore a striking similarity to plot elements from Polish writer Stanislaw Lem's (at the time) recent 1961 novel "Solaris." That novel would later be the basis of authorized films including a TV-Movie (Solaris (1968)) in 1968, a cinema version by Andrei Tarkovsky in 1972 (Solaris (1972)) (both from the Soviet Union) and an American production (Solaris (2002)) in 2002.

3209.name: Adventures of Captain Marvel
3209.storyline: This was the first depiction of a comic book superhero on film.

3210.name: Teenage Space Vampires
3210.storyline: Not the only time director Martin Wood would work with actor Robin Dunne. Robin played a main character, wrote for and directed for the show Sanctuary (2006 TV mini series) (2008-2011). Martin produced, directed and wrote for that show.

3211.name: Technotise: Edit & I
3211.storyline: The whole movie was made by 10-15 people (without the voice actors) and the production took place in a small apartment in Belgrade. It took them over 5 years to finish the movie on a low budget that reached almost US$900,000.

3212.name: A Nymphoid Barbarian in Dinosaur Hell
3212.storyline: According to Brett Piper, a distributor said that if he wanted his movies to succeed overseas, they should have all action and no dialogue. Piper made this movie and showed it to the same distributor, who said "Geez, I can't sell this thing, there's no dialogue!"

3213.name: The Hive
3213.storyline:
The blood on Penny's head appears and disappears multiple times.
It is seen in a straight line, smeared or completely gone.

3214.name: Doraemon: Nobita and the Galaxy Super-express

3215.name: The Returned
3215.storyline: Shawn Doyle (Jacob), Kris Holden-Ried (Alex Green) and Emily Hampshire (Kate) have worked with actor Tim Rozon in separate projects. Both Shawn and Kris have worked with Tim in the show Lost Girl (2010), playing Isaac Taft, Dyson Thornwood and Massimo/The Druid respectively; Emily worked with Tim in the show Schitt's Creek (2015), playing Stevie Budd and Mutt Schitt respectively.

3216.name: Beyond the Sky
3216.storyline: Travis Walton, the most famous alien abductee has a cameo as himself during the end credit.

3217.name: BioShock
3217.storyline: Based on the award-winning video game series.

3219.name: Sharkenstein
3219.storyline: The sticks of dynamite in the lighthouse near the dnd of the film are actually road flares.

3220.name: Digimon Adventure tri. Part 1: Reunion
3220.storyline: 15th Anniversary project for the Digimon franchise.

3221.name: Transmorphers: Mech Beasts
3221.storyline: This movie is a rip-off of Transformers: Rise of the Beasts.

3222.name: Bug
3222.storyline: The set used for the Parmiter home, (where Joanna Miles's character has her head set ablaze by a "bug"), was the same set at Paramount Studios in Hollywood as the one used for the interiors of the Brady home in the ABC television series, The Brady Bunch (1969). Due to very poor ratings, being massacred by Sanford and Son (1972), the series had been canceled in 1974, a few months before filming on this film began. Since this film's release in 1975, "The Brady Bunch" became a ubiquitous hit in syndication, and the set has become easily recognizable to several generations of classic TV watchers, even though the set was altered for use in this film.

3223.name: Macross Plus Movie Edition
3223.storyline: Unlike the four episode OVA series, this was not dubbed into English.

3224.name: Rammbock: Berlin Undead
3224.storyline: Michael: What's with the forks?Harper: AmmunitionMichael: These belong to GabiHarper: So get her new onesMichael: And what she comes back and sees what you did? Then what?Harper: I mean seriously, do you really think that when she comes home all that she will care about are the lousy forks?Michael: Yeah I believe it. I have to believe it, man, I mean its all I've got!Harper: Your breath smellsMichael: I guess I'm hungry

3225.name: Sri Asih
3225.storyline: Sri Asih is a comic character created by R.A. Kosasih. First published in 1954 by Melodie Publisher. In the early days of the development of Indonesian comics, comic artists tried to make works that were acceptable to cultural circles and educators.

3226.name: Tin Can
3226.storyline: I ended up watching the super disturbing Tin Can on a whim; drawn in by the artwork and thinking it might be a good claustrophobic sci-fi thriller like Meander (2020). Outside of the parrallels of a woman confined to a small area for a period of time, this couldn't be further from the aforementioned film and is an entirely different beast. Canadian director Seth Smith previously made the excellent indie horror The Crescent (2017) and this lines up perfectly with that one. The basic plot has a virologist studying a virus that has threatened humanity. As she is on the cusp of a great discovery, she is knocked unconsicious and wakes up in a isolation "prison" area. Smith stages things with great effect and the layered storytelling resulted in a great payoff for me. No spoilers for what happens as the story unfolds, but I will say it is a slow one that features one of the more messed up storylines I've seen in a while. And, given COVID, it is definitely timely (and shocking to find out this was all made pre-pandemic).

3227.name: Crime Zone
3227.storyline: Many of the extras in the movie were students at the American School of Lima, Colegio Franklin Delano Roosevelt. The large building figuring prominently is the present site of the Museo de la Nacion, on Avenida Javier Prado, in Lima.

3229.name: Extraordinary: The Stan Romanek Story
3229.storyline: The star and creator of this movie, Stan Romanek, was charged and convicted of possession of child pornography in August 2017.

3230.name: Cries of Ecstasy, Blows of Death
3230.storyline: The "Something Weird" version of this film runs 50 minutes, sans footage from George A. Romero's The Crazies (1973) in the opening in an effort to explain the lead up to the nuclear war.

3232.name: Global Meltdown
3232.storyline: Despite being settled in the present days, no sign of a GPS navigation system is to be seen throughout all of the movie and all the routes are checked on a paper road map.

3233.name: Slapstick of Another Kind
3233.storyline: The original 1982 cut of the movie featured a score by Michel Legrand. When the movie was re-edited and subsequently re-released in 1984, it was replaced with a more science-fiction-laced score by Morton Stevens (of Hawaii Five-O (1968) fame). A soundtrack LP was released containing on one side the score by Stevens and on the other side highlights of the score by Legrand.

3234.name: Mega Cyclone
3234.storyline: The actual title of this SyFy original movie is 'Space Twister'

3235.name: Asylum: Twisted Horror and Fantasy Tales

3236.name: Cyberella: Forbidden Passions
3236.storyline: In the first scene the girl checks the oven as if making dinner but there is clearly nothing in it.

3237.name: Sons of Steel
3237.storyline: The first film to be shot using digital live sync.

3238.name: Doraemon the Movie: Nobita and the Birth of Japan
3238.storyline: It is the 36th movie in Doraemon movie series.

3239.name: Futuresport
3239.storyline: The lead actors started a company designed to bring the game of Futuresport to the 1999 Christmas market.

3240.name: Birdemic 3: Sea Eagle
3240.storyline: Patsy van Ettinger who appeared in the first two films was scheduled to appear, but passed away before her scenes could be completed.

3241.name: Project Legion
3241.storyline: The film's working title was Apartment 213.

3242.name: Invisible Hacker
3242.storyline:

3244.name: Mesa of Lost Women
3244.storyline: Hoyt Curtin's original music score--consisting solely of guitar, bass and piano--was recycled by director Edward D. Wood Jr. for his film Jail Bait (1954).

3245.name: Alien Uprising
3245.storyline: Bianca Van Damme is the daughter of Jean-Claude Van Damme, who also appears in this film.

3246.name: Like Cattle Towards Glow
3246.storyline: One word: ridiculous. What a waste of time. Those writers have to be really messed up in the head to come with some stories like those in this "film".Really disturbing to think someone thought they were good enough to be part of a film. Just avoid at all cost.

3247.name: In the Aftermath
3247.storyline: The piano piece played in this film is 'Carnavalito Tango' written by Horatio Moscovici.

3248.name: Obsession: A Taste for Fear
3248.storyline: The Man I LoveWritten by Ira Gershwin and George GershwinPerformed by Pat Heaven and Lucia CappelliCourtesy of Warner Bros Music Italy Srl

3249.name: Polar Storm
3249.storyline: When the comet fragment is falling to Earth, Pam tells James that is going to land at 51 latitude, 179 longitude, and warns him that that is only 100 miles from his location. However, James and his partner were at the Arctic Circle in mainland Alaska; 51N 179W is about 17 miles south of Amatignak Island in the Aleutians, about 1500 miles away.

3250.name: It Lives Again
3250.storyline: The opening credits for the film were done using director Larry Cohen's own swimming pool.

3251.name: Doraemon: Nobita and the Tin Labyrinth

3252.name: Deranged
3252.storyline: Parasitic horsehair worms, or Nematomorpha, such as those which infect the victims in the movie do exist, although they only infect arthropods. Two species, Spinochordodes tellinii and Paragordius tricuspidatus, which infect Orthopteran insects, make their hosts drown themselves as depicted in the movie.

3254.name: Frankenstein Created Bikers
3254.storyline: Sequel to "Dear God No" from the same director.

3255.name: Skyrunners
3255.storyline: According to Kelly Blatz in an interview for the Canadian press, the precocious aging/transformation of Tyler Burns was not originally scripted, nor was it faked. Instead, it was written into the film when shooting in 2007 halted in order for Blatz to continue work on Aaron Stone. Filming resumed a year later, and by then Joey Pollari had already gone through a few mature changes. Therefore, his character's so called "puberty" was in fact real and it may be evident that the film was shot in chronological sequence.

3256.name: Valentine
3256.storyline: Valentine is a 2016 Indonesian action film based on Sarjono Sutrisno, Aswin MC Siregar & Ian Waryanto, Skylar Comics character Valentine.

3257.name: Mission Galactica: The Cylon Attack
3257.storyline: "Mission Galactica: The Cylon Attack" was given a limited theatrical release in 1979, making it a sequel of sorts to the theatrical version of the series pilot. However, no explanation is given for the appearance of John Colicos as Baltar, who was killed off in the first film.

3258.name: Mark Antony
3258.storyline: Mark Antony: What's bad in good? What's good in bad?

3259.name: Sweet Prudence and the Erotic Adventure of Bigfoot

3260.name: Reaper
3260.storyline: A good portion of the film was shot at The Glen Tavern Inn, whose motto is "Where the Past Comes to Life," because the dead reportedly maintain a vivid presence at the hotel. The Glen Tavern is a favorite of paranormal aficionados who claim it is one of the most haunted venues in the region, and in July 2007, the Ventura Paranormal Society held its annual convention there..

3261.name: Stargames
3261.storyline: The film was riffed by Mystery Science Theater 3000 (1988) alum Michael J. Nelson, Bill Corbett, and Kevin Murphy.

3262.name: Mega Python vs. Gatoroid
3262.storyline: In the scene in the film where Nikki and a group of animal rights protesters are picketing in front of the Park Ranger station, one of the protesters can be seen wearing an Electric Youth-era Debbie Gibson T-shirt and another one wearing a Tiffany "Hold An Old Friends Hand" Album Tour shirt.

3263.name: Battledogs
3263.storyline: The tranquilizer gun that is used on the lone werewolf that escapes from the line at about 10:55 is actually a Nerf Maverick toy dart 6 barrel revolver blaster. The top rear of the blaster has black tape over where the Nerf logo is. The type of darts that this blaster fires are foam with a soft rubber tip, not a sharp tipped tranquilizer dart.

3264.name: Neptune Frost
3264.storyline: Referenced in Film Junk Podcast: Episode 855: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On (2022)

3265.name: Rise of the Dinosaurs
3265.storyline: The cover used on some streaming platforms for this movie is featuring an obviously stolen dinosaur from the game "Turok Evolution".

3266.name: Gantz: Perfect Answer
3266.storyline: Featured in WatchMojo: Top 10 WORST Live Action Anime Films (2017)

3267.name: Vampire Zombies... From Space!
3267.storyline: What can I say? This movie was hilarious from start to finish. I was laughing my ass off the entire time, trying to breathe in-between. It had everything. AMAZING characters, everyone you can think of from that era. So ya, it was doing a spoof of the classic 50's and 60's movies where basically aliens or monsters attack a small town in the middle of the USA and everyone with different backgrounds has to come together to fight the aliens and save the day (but in this instance its vampire zombies!!!!!When I heard before the festival that it was in black and white I was a bit hesitant because even some of the best horror classics that I love are in color almost always. But once you get about 5-10 minutes in the film you realize that it had to be black and white!Go see this film!

3268.name: Category 6: Day of Destruction
3268.storyline: After the Las Vegas tornadoes, Andy mentions that they were as strong as "Oklahoma City in 1999." Later in the movie when several stock videos of tornadoes are shown as the storm approaches Chicago, the video of the large tornado with the small satellite tornado to the left of it is the actual tornado that hit the Oklahoma City area in 1999. It is often referred to as the Bridge Creek Tornado due to the horrific damage it caused in that community, and at the time and still to this day it had the highest winds recorded in a tornado in history.

3270.name: Shank
3270.storyline: While filming in the Heygate Estate in Walworth, South London during September 2009, neighbors complained about the way the film-makers were depicting gangs and turf wars.

3271.name: Dinosaur Valley Girls
3271.storyline: The last film appearance of William Marshall (1924-2003)

3272.name: The Misty Green Sky
3272.storyline: Some of the character models are based on robots from other films and TV series, including two of Robby the Robot from Forbidden Planet (1956) and a Cybermen from Doctor Who (2005).

3273.name: Deleter
3273.storyline: The film opens with the 2010's variant of the Viva Films logo, even though the newest variant was used in its trailer.

3274.name: Sparks
3274.storyline: William Katt had his own comic book company with a character of" Sparks"

3275.name: Brand Upon the Brain!
3275.storyline: Shot in nine days and edited over three months.

3277.name: The Prey: Legend of Karnoctus
3277.storyline: Originally, Michael Clark Duncan was signed on to star as the character "Reid." However, due to his unfortunate passing in 2012, he was then replaced by Kevin Grevioux.

3278.name: The Passenger
3278.storyline: Paula Gallego replaced another actress just a few days before shooting began. She was well known in Spain for her role as 'Mara Alcntara" in the TV Series "Cuntame" but "La Pasajera" is her feature film debut.

3279.name: Saranjana: Kota Ghaib
3279.storyline: The movie title is written in both Latin and Arabic script.

3280.name: Savage
3280.storyline: Five of the characters are named after America's authors - Burroughs, Wallace, Poe, Spillane, Verne.

3281.name: Ravagers
3281.storyline: The "abandoned missile base" in the movie, is actually the Alabama Space and Rocket Center museum, and the "Rocket Park" is in the backlot of the museum. The museum benefitted from the filming of this movie, because the display rockets had to be "aged" for the film, and then later cleaned. The bi-annually cleaning of these outdoor displays is a major expense.

3282.name: Thirst
3282.storyline: Actor David Hemmings once said of this film during filming: "This crew is the best I've worked with in five years. What is happening out here in Australia is very exciting and I plan to become involved...I thought the script for 'Thirst ' was very commercial and had the potential for international success".

3283.name: Sleep Dealer
3283.storyline: Wilhelm Scream - When man falls off of horse in the first sequence where Memo is watching TV (after "Are Your Nodes Dirty?")

3284.name: Cute Little Buggers
3284.storyline: In the credits, after the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Assistant Producers, Simon Moon is listed as the 4rd Assistant Producer rather than the 4th Assistant Producer.

3285.name: The I Inside
3285.storyline: Christian Slater (as Peter), Stephen Dorff (as Simon Cable), and Jennifer Love Hewitt (as Anna Cable) were originally set to star.

3286.name: Terror Out of the Sky
3286.storyline: The man driving the flatbed truck carrying the hive of killer bees, and who gets killed by them, is actually Norman Gary, the bee wrangler/handler for this film. Gary had done the same two things in this film's predecessor, The Savage Bees (1976).

3287.name: What Women Want
3287.storyline: In Germany, the film was marketed as a sequel to What Women Want (2000) rather than a remake.

3288.name: Air Hawks
3288.storyline: In the scene where Ralph Bellamy pushes the broken down taxi from the drive the shadow of the mic can be seen on the roof of the taxi in the dialogue which follows.

3289.name: The Broken Key
3289.storyline: Trailer Release at TOHorror Fantastic Film Fest (2017)

3291.name: Living Among Us
3291.storyline: The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts & Sciences requested for the script for Living Among Us (written by Brian A. Metcalf) to be placed inside their Permanent Core Collection in the Margaret Herrick Library.

3292.name: Ivan Vasilyevich Changes His Profession
3292.storyline: Miloslavski's quote "Gentlemen, keep your money in your bank, if you have any" is a pun to the commercial slogan of the soviet bank "Bank of the working, saving and loaning people of the USSR", also know as the "Savingbank of the USSR".

3293.name: Littlemouth
3293.storyline: Isabelle Fuhrman and Josh Hutcherson have both appeared in The Hunger Games (2012). Dennis Quaid's son, Jack Quaid, also appeared in The Hunger Games (2012).

3295.name: Mega Piranha
3295.storyline: When Actor Paul Logan was kicking the piranhas, he was not actually kicking anything.

3296.name: The Curse of the Komodo
3296.storyline: The compound house is from fantasy island

3297.name: The Terminal Man
3297.storyline: Crichton was fired from writing the screenplay due to the fact that his script did not follow the novel (which he had written) closely enough.

3298.name: Endangered Species
3298.storyline: Although the location of where the movie is set is never disclosed, a map of St. Louis Missouri is plainly seen in the police station showing victims photos affixed to different areas on the map.

3299.name: Space Girls in Beverly Hills
3299.storyline: Final film of Julie Strain, there's another still filming,

3300.name: The Exotic Time Machine II: Forbidden Encounters
3300.storyline: Many of the costumes are from the television series 'V' (1984)

3301.name: We Lost Our Human
3301.storyline: Ben Schwartz and Ayo Edebiri, who voiced Pud and Ham, separately played a character in different Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles entries: Schwartz played Leonardo in Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Movie. and Edebiri played April O'Neil in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem.

3302.name: Gamera vs. Gyaos
3302.storyline: Ishir Honda is said have been impressed with this film and reportedly sent screenwriter Niisan Takahashi a New Year's card congratulating him on a job well done.

3303.name: Alien Apocalypse
3303.storyline: References Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)

3304.name: Interstelar
3304.storyline: Most profit movie in history of Russia. With the budget of 65 Russian rubles profit by online distributing was 17 552 Russian rubles. Coefficient of profitability is 270.

3305.name: Seveneves
3305.storyline: Based on the Neal Stephenson novel

3310.name: Gurren Lagann the Movie: Childhood's End
3310.storyline: The Gurren Brigade: Who the hell do you think we are?

3311.name: Red 11
3311.storyline: Per Robert Rodriguez the budget was $7000; the same as his first movie which the story is based on he he got that money.

3312.name: The Neanderthal Man
3312.storyline: When the Professor gives his talk to the Scientific Society, he uses the Piltdown Man in the progression "Chimp - Java Man - Piltdown Man - Cro-Magnon Man - Neanderthal Man - Modern Human." The Piltdown Man was a fake fossil that was comprehensively debunked in 1953, the same year that the film was released.

3313.name: House of Dracula
3313.storyline: Actor Glenn Strange suffered greatly during the shooting of the scene in which the Frankenstein Monster is discovered in quicksand. After sitting for three hours in the makeup chair each morning, having his makeup applied by Jack P. Pierce, Strange would spend the rest of the day buried in cold liquid mud (which doubled for the quicksand). "Then everybody else went out for lunch," Strange recalled. "By the time they came back, I was so cold, I could barely feel my legs." Strange's co-star, Lon Chaney Jr., suggested that Strange use alcohol to keep himself warm. Throughout the day, Chaney passed a bottle of whiskey to Strange in-between takes. By the end of the day, Strange recalled, he was so drunk he could barely dress himself after removing his monster makeup and costume.

3314.name: Assassination Classroom
3314.storyline: A sequel to this film titled 'Assassination Classroom: Graduation' will be released in 2016.

3315.name: Sharktopus vs. Pteracuda
3315.storyline: Production on this film lasted three years. Producer Roger Corman called it "grueling."

3316.name: Evil Aliens
3316.storyline: The lighter shown in the beginning has the smiley face and blood splatter used in the Watchmen comic book. It is later used to blow up the liquid manure house.

3317.name: The Black-Eyed Children
3317.storyline: ArtifactWritten and performed by Dane E. ConnorCourtesy of DistroKid

3318.name: Gamera vs. Barugon
3318.storyline: This is the only film in the original series to not feature a child as the main human character.

3319.name: Sea Beast
3319.storyline: The final climactic scenes were filmed aboard the decommissioned Queen of Sidney, a 138-car ferry that served the British Columbia Ferry Corporation from 1960 to 2000. It now rests in the Silverdale Ferry Graveyard near Mission, BC.

3320.name: Homoti
3320.storyline: Featured in The Cinema Snob: Homoti (2011)

3321.name: Zone Troopers
3321.storyline: William Paulson, who plays the alien, can also be seen out of makeup at the beginning of the movie. He plays a soldier in an Army Jeep.

3322.name: Flash Gordon's Trip to Mars
3322.storyline: In the stock footage from Flash Gordon (1936), shown in this film, as Flash is telling The Clay People about his previous encounter with Emperor Ming, Ming is bald and Dale Arden has blond hair. In this sequel, Ming has "pasted on" hair and Dale is a brunette. It has been reported that Jean Rogers (Dale Arden) had many other film roles pending at that time (1938) that called for her to be a brunette.

3323.name: Maniac
3323.storyline: Several key cast members are uncredited, and their identities remain unknown, most notably "Goof" the cat-hoarding neighbor, the detective, the skinny morgue attendant, Maria Altura (who Dr. Meirschultz brings back to life), and Altura's body double (for scenes requiring nudity).

3324.name: Doraemon The Movie: Nobita's Great Battle of the Mermaid King
3324.storyline: The 30th film of Doraemon movie series celebrating Doraemon 40th anniversary.

3325.name: Redline
3325.storyline: To get Rutger Hauer to agree to do this movie, Writer and Director Tibor Takcs personally paid for him to live as a homeless man for eight months in Siberia.

3326.name: The Invisible Ray
3326.storyline: The set for Dr. Rukh's laboratory appeared as that of Ming the Merciless in Flash Gordon (1936) and Countess Zelaska's castle in Dracula's Daughter (1936).

3327.name: Dimensions
3327.storyline: Although the first and last scenes appear to be identical, there are lots of small differences as they are actually only similar events in two different timelines.

3328.name: The Stepford Children
3328.storyline: Why would Stepford's male authorities risk going to the trouble of digging an actual grave (with identifying headstone no less) to bury the mechanical clone of Steven Harding's first wife when doing so would leave such horrific evidence for potential outside investigators to, literally, unearth--as indeed second wife does? (Barbara Eden disinterring a grave...yikes!)

3330.name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
3330.storyline: Underwater cameras were not used. The Williamson brothers had developed a system of watertight tubes and mirrors, like an upside-down periscope, and were dependent on the clarity of water and sunshine to provide the necessary light.

3331.name: Jack Brooks: Monster Slayer
3331.storyline: No CGI was used in this film for any of the effects.

3332.name: CobraGator
3332.storyline: CobraGator was directed by Jim Wynorski for Roger Corman and the Syfy Channel, but as of March 2021, it still hasn't been released. An online petition was launched in mid 2020 to get it released.

3333.name: Mr. X
3333.storyline: Remake of Ashok Kuamr's film Mr x 1957 directed by Nanabhai Bhatt, father of Mahesh Bhatt.

3334.name: Descent
3334.storyline: The "Spartan GT Supercomputer" is actually a Dell PowerEdge 4200 server.

3335.name: Watchers II
3335.storyline: Though ostensibly a sequel to Watchers (1988), this movie is self-contained and does not follow the plot of the earlier film. The same can be said for Watchers III (1994) and Watchers Reborn (1998).

3336.name: Tara and Akash: Love Beyond Realms

3337.name: The Wrestling Women vs. the Aztec Mummy
3337.storyline: In the English-dubbed version of this film, some of the characters' names were Americanized; for example, Chucho Gomez is re-named Tommy and Chela is re-named Charlotte.

3338.name: A Hard Problem
3338.storyline: [first lines] Ian: [leaving a phone message] She's gone. It was peaceful, in her sleep.Ian: Call me as soon as you can. I have my phone, and .. and mom's. I'd really like to see you, or at least hear from you.

3339.name: A Cold Night's Death
3339.storyline: Dr. Frank Enari: Now, who cooks?Dr. Robert Jones: In the interests of mercy, you cook.Dr. Frank Enari: I, I cook. And who cleans?Dr. Robert Jones: Aw, that's always the guy who cooks.

3340.name: Track of the Moon Beast
3340.storyline: Frank Larrabee and his band performed their song "California Lady" in the film after they were coerced by the filmmakers. The film crew and the band were both staying in the local Ramada Inn in Albuquerque where the performance footage was shot.

3341.name: Infinitum: Subject Unknown
3341.storyline: As the film was shot during the first UK lockdown in 2020, only Matthew and Tori were ever on set. The rest of the crew would review footage remotely. Ian McKellen and Conleth Hill's footage was shot by them with Matthew directing online.

3342.name: Half-Life
3342.storyline: This project was confirmed by Gabe Newell and JJ Abrams at the 2013 DICE Summit when they discussed storytelling in movies and video games.

3343.name: Spark: A Space Tail
3343.storyline: This is Jace Norman's first non-television movie.

3345.name: Cronus
3345.storyline: Lead actor Joey Folsom filmed the entirety of Cronus in Fort Worth, Texas while simultaneously starring in the play The Year of the Rooster in Dallas, TX for Upstart Productions. Half way through filming, his left foot was broken during a performance. He continued filming without missing a day, including all of the chase scenes. It wasn't until after he was wrapped that director Derek Presley was let in on the secret of his injury.

3347.name: Odd Squad: The Movie
3347.storyline: Millie Davis's character of Ms. O is heavily implied to be immortal. Jack McBrayer - who plays Weird Tom - also played a character in the NBC series 30 Rock (2006) who was heavily implied to be immortal as well.

3348.name: Sabar Ini Ujian
3348.storyline: This is the first original Hotstar movie from Indonesia under the name of Disney+ Hotstar.

3349.name: America 3000
3349.storyline: Laurene Landon threatened to quit acting in this film towards the end of production because she had yet to get paid for several weeks worth of work.

3350.name: Battle Star Wars
3350.storyline: This film is a ripoff of a famous film series called Star Wars

3351.name: The Final Level: Escaping Rancala
3351.storyline: WILHELM SCREAM at ~00:31 (Level Boss falling down into the snakes pit)

3352.name: Indestructible Man
3352.storyline: Although Joe Flynn played a serious role, audiences laughed at him. This convinced him that comedy was his forte, and he later specialized in comedic roles, most memorably as the irascible Capt. Binghamton in McHale's Navy (1962).

3354.name: Starman
3354.storyline: Remake of the 1984 movie of the same name staring Jeff Bridges.

3356.name: Max Reload and the Nether Blasters
3356.storyline: Martin Kove, who plays Gramps Jenkins, and Jesse Kove, who plays Steve the delivery guy, are father and son.

3357.name: The Amazing Transparent Man
3357.storyline: This was shot back-to-back with Beyond the Time Barrier (1960). The combined shooting schedule was only two weeks. They became Edgar G. Ulmer's last American films.

3358.name: Urusei Yatsura 2: Beautiful Dreamer
3358.storyline: Director Mamoru Oshii mentioned that the scene recreating the original Godzilla (1954) film had to be done by entirely by memory since the film wasn't available on home video yet to use as a reference.

3359.name: Deep Space
3359.storyline: Fred Olen Ray said he wrote the script in 1984 but put it away thinking no one would want to make it. Then he started showing it around in 1987 and was surprised at all the actors who read it and wanted to be in it.

3360.name: Rocko's Modern Life: Static Cling
3360.storyline: The Fatheads VHS tape is orange. The Nickelodeon tapes from the 90s were all Nickelodeon orange.

3361.name: Where Time Began
3361.storyline: Never released in British theaters, this film was first released in the UK on ITV during Christmas Day of 1978.

3363.name: The Corpse Vanishes
3363.storyline: Filmed 3/13/42-4/1/42, the fourth of Bela Lugosi's nine Monogram features.

3364.name: Seedpeople
3364.storyline: The film's video trailer reuses music from Subspecies.

3366.name: City Limits
3366.storyline: This movie was featured on Mystery Science Theater 3000 (season 5, episode 3).

3367.name: Feeders
3367.storyline: Shot in only four days in July 1994.

3368.name: Arrival II
3368.storyline: Patrick Muldoon plays the brother of Charlie Sheen's character in this movie. One year earlier, he played the love interest of Denise Richards in Starship Troopers (1997). Sheen and Richards would later get married, and divorced four years later.

3369.name: Casshern
3369.storyline: One of several films around the world that was produced almost entirely on a "digital backlot" (i.e. shot with the actors in front of blue/green-screens with all backgrounds added in post-production, a technique which has been used for TV, video and video game production for many years). Although which movie was shot first is debated, the other movies (released in 2004-05) include: Immortal (2004), Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow (2004), and Sin City (2005).

3370.name: Hirokin: The Last Samurai
3370.storyline: Hiro is the Japanese word for hero.

3371.name: Xtro II: The Second Encounter
3371.storyline: This sequel has nothing to do the original Xtro (1982). This is because director Harry Bromley Davenport somehow retained the rights to the name Xtro but not the story rights. Needing money he enlisted writers to write a completely different film and only use the Xtro name to capitalize on the cult success of the original.

3373.name: Satria Dewa: Gatotkaca
3373.storyline: Originally directed by Charles Gozali, But They Replace by Hanung Bramantyo.

3374.name: Pokmon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea
3374.storyline: This was the first Pokemon film to have new dub actors. The only voice to remain the same was Wobbuffet, played by Kayzie Rogers.

3375.name: Killer Crocodile
3375.storyline: This film and its sequel Killer Crocodile II (1990) were filmed simultaneously.

3376.name: Just Imagine
3376.storyline: Of the film's credited cast members, only Maureen O'Sullivan (LN-18) and Joyzelle Joyner (Loo Loo / Boo Boo) were still alive during the actual 1980. O'Sullivan died on June 23, 1998 whereas Joyner died on November 30, 1980, coincidentally only one week after the 50th anniversary of the film's release.

3377.name: White Dwarf
3377.storyline:
The TV movie was conceived as a pilot for a new series to fill Fox's 1995-1996 season's lineup. Due to some production delays, creator Bruce Wagner was hoping for a mid-season pickup.
The pilot was televised against Full House (1987) and placed 66th in the weekly ratings, with 5.7 million TV households and 10% of share. It never got picked up.

3378.name: Die, Monster, Die!
3378.storyline: Because of his back problems and his difficulty walking, the screenplay was written so that Boris Karloff could perform his role while seated in a wheelchair.

3379.name: Animator vs. Animation V
3379.storyline: This is actually a combination of the 4 connected episodes in Season 2 of Animator vs. Animation (2006).

3380.name: BoBoiBoy Movie 2
3380.storyline: The poster of this film were eventually keep by Astro Shaw as distributor. Recently on video cast revealing Keluang Man (2025), the poster were shown when Anwari Ashraf (director of Keluang Man) video called Nas-T as Keluang Man.

3381.name: The Crimson Ghost
3381.storyline: Bud Geary wore the robes of the Crimson Ghost, but the voice that came out of the stationary skeletal mouth was that of I. Stanford Jolley, who was billed fourth in the cast. Another actor dubbed Jolley's character's response on the radio. Finally, a fourth actor played the Crimson Ghost's alter ego.

3382.name: The Alligator People
3382.storyline: In 1983, 20th Century-Fox produced a video game adaption of the film for the Atari 2600. It loosely follows the plot of the film, unlike some other 20th Century-Fox adaptations, which just used a film title. Though the game never saw an official release, a completed prototype has since surfaced and is available online.

3384.name: Maximum Shame
3384.storyline: Nominated for Best Feature Movie at BUT (B-Movie, Underground and Trash) Film Festival, Breda, The Netherlands, September 2010.

3385.name: The Phantom Warrior
3385.storyline: Clair de Lunewritten by Claude Debussy

3386.name: O-Bi, O-Ba: The End of Civilization
3386.storyline: I like Polish films, I've seen a lot, all of Andrzej Wajda's films, all of Polanski's, some of Jerzy Skolimowski's, some of Andrzej Zulawski's, some of Krzysztof Kieslowski's, some of Krzysztof Zanussi's, etc. They are not easy to digest, just as this "O-Bi, O-Ba: The End of Civilization" is not (the meaning of "O-Bi, O-Ba" is not clear at all). It is the first film made by director Piotr Szulkin that I have seen. I saw Jerzy Stuhr in the very special "Sexmission" (1984) and in "A Year of the Quiet Sun" (1984). I saw the beautiful Krystyna Janda in "Man of Iron" (1981), "Mephisto" (1981), "The Conductor" (1980), "Man of Marble" (1977). Another well-known name is Leon Niemczyk, probably the most prolific Polish actor of all time (325 films) seen by me in many, the most famous being "Knife in the Water" (1962). OK, about the movie now: I'm not going to narrate it like many do. I'll just say that it's worth seeing, even though it's just talk in a closed space, an underground bunker (where, strange situation, after the nuclear war, there is electricity, there are neon lights everywhere). The fact that it is filmed a lot in motion by the talented Witold Sobocinski, mitigates the phenomenon of claustrophobia.

3387.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
3387.storyline: This was Mickey Rooney's last film.

3388.name: Sailor Moon SuperS: The Movie: Black Dream Hole
3388.storyline: The movie features the only on-screen appearance of Ami's mother in the anime continuity.

3389.name: Proteus
3389.storyline: Metrotime, a production company formed by Metrodome and the Lifetime Group, were originally set to produce, before the two companies split over creative differences.

3390.name: Chiller
3390.storyline: Mimi Craven, Wes Craven's wife at the time, cameos as Nurse Cooper. She also played a nurse in Craven's most well-known film, A Nightmare on Elm Street (1984).

3391.name: Rewind
3391.storyline: This was a pilot for a series that was not picked up by the network. It was the second attempt in the 2000's to revamp the successful 1960's Irwin Allen series The Time Tunnel. Allen was the blockbuster TV producer of Lost In Space, Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea and Land of the Giants. Like the other Time Tunnel reboot, both suffered from being too similar to the already successful and recent Stargate.

3392.name: Tokyo Revengers 2: Bloody Halloween - Decisive Battle

3393.name: Entrails of a Virgin
3393.storyline: Featured in The Cinema Snob: Entrails of a Virgin (2011)

3394.name: Bloodsuckers
3394.storyline: Damian Underwood: The universe was filled with intelligent life...most of it VAMPIRIC.

3395.name: Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex - Solid State Society
3395.storyline: As part of the Nissan sponsorship, the movie features two concept cars designed by Nissan. The character Togusa drives a white Nissan's Sport Concept hatchback, and both Togusa and Aramaki travel in Nissan's six seater Infiniti Kuraza. Nissan's six seater Infiniti Kuraza's license plate is 3923 which read as san-kyuu-ni-san (in Japanese) or "Thank you Nissan".

3396.name: The Brain from Planet Arous
3396.storyline: The special eye effects for Steve March were created by having John Agar wear special black contact lenses that were very thick. The extreme thickness of the contact made it painful for Agar to wear them.

3397.name: Zerograd
3397.storyline: Official submission of Soviet Union for the 'Best Foreign Language Film' category of the 62th Academy Awards in 1990.

3398.name: Dinocroc vs. Supergator
3398.storyline: David Carradine only worked in this film for one day.

3399.name: Tekken: Blood Vengeance
3399.storyline: This films story is based after Tekken 5.

3401.name: The Ultimate Warrior
3401.storyline: Max von Sydow, who plays Joanna Miles' father in the film, was in reality only eleven years older than her.

3402.name: Black Friday
3402.storyline: In spite of Boris Karloff and Bela Lugosi receiving top billing, neither actor would dominate the story-line. Character actor Stanley Ridges would take center stage.

3403.name: Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz
3403.storyline: The secret papers that the Spetsnaz retrieve at the beginning, read "Die Deutsche Arbeitgfront" in gothic print. Somehow, the letter "s" got mixed up with a "g".

3404.name: Copy
3404.storyline: Copy is a copy of Tamil movie called Vyapari -2007

3405.name: Rogue Warrior: Robot Fighter
3405.storyline: Although the spaceship and poster layout looks remarkable similar to the Mandalorian, the film came out a full 2 years before the show premiered on Disney Plus in 2018. Director Neil Johnson cites this as a co-incidence, though notes that both shows have the same space prison deign - the white hexagonal walls look almost identical, and Neil considers this a wonderful homage to his own film.

3406.name: Incoming
3406.storyline: They have said/mentioned in several scenes that the space prison is a modified International Space Station. However on a external pan away from the station as the they view space for the first time. It pans so far away from the window the ISS looks like it's now orbiting the moon.The ISS has a Low Earth Orbit, which is a little over 200 miles. The moon is at least 221 thousand miles away, depending on the time of year.

3407.name: Bud Abbott and Lou Costello Meet the Invisible Man
3407.storyline: The last names of Bud Abbott and Lou Costello's characters, Bud Alexander and Lou Francis, are actually their real middle names.

3408.name: Outsiders
3408.storyline: If I had known this movie ended so abruptly I would not have watched it. All actors were great. The story line just stopped, quit, cut off. Over and out.

3409.name: Catwoman: Hunted
3409.storyline: Stephanie Beatriz campaigned to be the new Batwoman for Batwoman (2019) after series star Ruby Rose left.

3410.name: Spermula
3410.storyline: In 1976 a German magazine featured an article, ranting in indignation about Irina Ionesco letting her then 11 year old daughter, Eva Ionesco, appear in this 'adult' film, and appearing naked at that (though evidently not in any sex scenes). This article included still shots of Eva from the set, both dressed and fully nude, as well as alongside other women who do appear in the film, so clearly she was attached to the project at one point or another. However, there are currently 3 different versions of this film floating around now-days, none of which has *any* scenes with Eva Ionesco, nor does any of them include her name in the credits. So it is highly plausible that all of her scenes were never intended to actually be included in the final version of the film, but whether the whole thing was just a publicity stunt orchestrated by her mother (one of quite a few in the mid 70's), or what other reasons there may have been is anyone's guess.

3411.name: Prey
3411.storyline: The bird Wally was a cockatoo that often refused to perform when needed and squawked loudly off-camera, frequently causing problems with the sound recording. He eventually escaped from his cage and was never seen again.

3412.name: Welcome to Willits
3412.storyline: Feature-length version of the 2013 short film Welcome to Willits: After Sundown (2013) that was nominated for Grand Jury Award at the SXSW festival.

3413.name: The OctoGames
3413.storyline: Poorly written. Badly acted. Cheaply made. Clearly made to cash in on the success of the Netflix show Squid Game.Although, all the above being said, it is at least vaguely watchable. Granted, it isn't Lord of the Rings or Citizen Kane but they have at least had a stab at creating characters and have them react to each other.So many bits of the film make no sense to me. Why the fox outfit? Why keep one living? Who was the guy at the end? Why would YouTubers and instagram addicts give up their phones so readily?Clearly, I cannot recommend this movie. Go watch Squid Game, it was made by people with talent.

3414.name: Tom's Midnight Garden
3414.storyline: The clock in Tom's office at the start of this movie is the clock from the house.

3415.name: Absolon
3415.storyline: David De Bartolome's first studio film.

3416.name: Debug
3416.storyline: Jason Momoa (I Am) previously co-starred with the director David Hewlett in Stargate: Atlantis (2004). They played Ronon Dex and Dr. Rodney McKay, respectively.

3417.name: Devil's Triangle
3417.storyline: The name of the actor who portrays the KING is Myrom KINGery.

3418.name: Manborg
3418.storyline: A lot of this film was shot in the garage of Steven Kostanski's home.

3419.name: Top Line
3419.storyline: George Kennedy's voice was dubbed by another actor.

3420.name: Shin Jigen! Crayon Shin-chan the Movie

3421.name: American Cyborg: Steel Warrior
3421.storyline: The final movie of the infamous movie production duo Menahem Golan and Yoram Globus.

3422.name: Babylon 5: In the Beginning
3422.storyline: Both the children and the Centauri woman are members of Emperor Londo Mollari's household, and all got there through murder. Luc and Lyssa are the niece and nephew of Urza Jaddo, whom Mollari killed in a duel in Knives (1995). Senna, the Centauri woman, is the daughter of Lord Refa, whom Mollari had assassinated in And the Rock Cried Out, No Hiding Place (1996). In both cases, Mollari took the children of his victims into his family.

3423.name: Oceans Rising
3423.storyline: The aerial view of CERN is actually of Fermi Lab just west of Chicago, IL.

3424.name: The Dinosaur Project
3424.storyline: Featured in Projector: The Dinosaur Project (2012)

3425.name: Candy Stripers
3425.storyline: The on set grip and electric crew, Snakebite and the Bull Pricks enjoyed this film on Memorial Day 2016 shortly after finishing production on a horror film, Party Crasher.

3426.name: Zebraman
3426.storyline: During the introductory section of the film, Shinichi Ichikawa/Zebraman, is watching a parody of Super Sentai/Power Rangers where the hero fights Sadako Yamamura from "The Ring". Ironically, this seems to predict the plot of the 2007 film, "Kamen Rider: The Next", which features a Sadako-like antagonist and a plot similar to "The Ring".

3427.name: Cyborg X
3427.storyline: First American production credit for German singer Julian Thome.

3428.name: Future Shock
3428.storyline: The movie has a tie-in comic book adaptation of the same name that got released in 1993 under the one-off "Sci-Fi Comix" brand. There are some slight differences between some story elements in the comic and in the movie as if the comic was based on an earlier draft of the film's script. For instance, the doctor in the comic is evil and wants to control the minds of his patients, while the psychiatrist in the film is actually rather benevolent and well-intentioned. The comic is briefly shown in the 'making of' featurette found among the bonus material on the DVD release of the movie.

3429.name: Bling
3429.storyline: The pass code to enter Oscar's lair (36-24-36) is historically considered to be a woman's "ideal" measurements.

3430.name: Death of a Rockstar
3430.storyline: I didn't know what to expect from an animated rock opera, but this movie really delivered on every level. The animation and colors had a groovy 70s quality, as did the music. And in the best possible way, very David Bowie/Aerosmith vibes with a dose of Andrew Lloyd Webber thrown in. There were some scenes and visuals that were laugh-out-loud funny, too. But it was more than just great music and laughs, the plot had an awesome theme about freedom, which totally goes hand in hand with rock n roll.

3431.name: The Monster of Piedras Blancas
3431.storyline: The feet and lower torso of the Monster suit were were recycled from the "Metaluna Mutant" in This Island Earth (1955), with the claws being recycled from the creatures in The Mole People (1956).

3432.name: The Jetsons Meet the Flintstones
3432.storyline: Last time most of the original casts of both shows performed their characters.

3433.name: Gamera vs. Zigra
3433.storyline: "Gamera vs. Zigra" was the only classic Gamera film not released in the U.S. until the advent of home video. All the previous films had been picked up for theatrical distribution or for television. "Gamera vs. Zigra" first appeared in the U.S. in 1987 via videotape, long after its Japanese release.

3434.name: Monster Hunt 2
3434.storyline: The visual effects were rendered by half a dozen companies and required a multinational effort, Industrial Light & Magic and Whiskytree from the U.S., and China's BaseFX in Beijing, Original Force in Nanjing, Trouper Visual Effects in Shanghai and CGCG in Taiwan.

3435.name: Invention for Destruction
3435.storyline: The animation and production design are intended to evoke the woodcut illustrations of the original Jules Verne novels.

3436.name: Samurai Jack: The Premiere Movie
3436.storyline: This movie is made up of the first three episodes of the TV series, Samurai Jack (2001).

3437.name: 500 MPH Storm
3437.storyline: At 28:41 neither of the vehicles in the collision has an engine suggesting the film crew flatbedded the two junkers to the site.

3438.name: Caltiki, the Immortal Monster
3438.storyline: Riccardo Freda later claimed that he abandoned the project so Mario Bava, who he knew could be a good director, would have a chance to direct.

3439.name: Tokyo Revengers 2: Bloody Halloween - Destiny
3439.storyline: Followed by Tokyo Revengers 2: Bloody Halloween - Decisive Battle (2023)

3440.name: King of Thorn
3440.storyline: Before the doors on the cryogenic tubes close, you can just briefly catch that the display monitor reads "NO MAN".

3441.name: Aiden
3441.storyline: Beautifully shot and some terrific suspense. The pacing is very good as well as some of the character conflict. Effect were very efficient considering the low budget.Beautiful landscape. There was a lot of tension that kept me hooked in on the story. I also think the writers did a good job of establishing the characters. There was a perfect balance of internal and external conflict. I thought the character of Aiden was a well-written and relatable character.The cinematography was very creative and fluid. The film makes a good use of it's landscape to reflect the character's inner turmoil. Definitely recommend it.

3443.name: Jurassic Thunder
3443.storyline: At about 20 minutes the president greets the Russians by name, then immediately denies knowing them. Either a failed attempt to mislead, or a sign of dementia.

3444.name: Can of Worms
3444.storyline: This is the first Disney Channel Original Movie (DCOM) to receive a TV-PG rating.

3445.name: Pokmon the Movie: Hoopa and the Clash of Ages
3445.storyline: The production team went to Dubai as location scouting for the setting of the movie, Dahara City.

3446.name: Army of Frankensteins
3446.storyline: Stars John Ferguson, Oklahoma's Count Gregore of Nightmare Theater fame on KOCO 5. Was also a tv pioneer on the Foreman Scotty show on wky 4 in the 50s. Unofficially the longest running horror tv host in the country.

3447.name: Bloodwork
3447.storyline: On Showtime Beyond the title of the movie is Bloodworx, 2012, TV-MA, V, S, L.

3448.name: 2099: The Soldier Protocol
3448.storyline: Dr Snyder puts his right hand on the palm reader but it shows a left hand on the display.

3449.name: It's Okay Go Back to Sleep
3449.storyline: This filmed at the Pfizer factory in Kent where Viagra was invented.

3450.name: 2047: Virtual Revolution
3450.storyline: During filming, Maximilien Poullein insisted on meeting Jane Badler even though they shared no scene together. Indeed, as a kid, Poullein was so afraid of Badler's role in V (1984) he did not even want to wear green because that was the skin color of the "lizards from outer space" in the TV series.

3451.name: The Beast of Hollow Mountain
3451.storyline: The first feature film to combine stop-motion animation with anamorphic Cinemascope and color.

3452.name: Shark Island
3452.storyline: This TV movie uses same lines as "Jaws" in some scenes. And lifts the actual name of the shark robot from "Jaws"

3453.name: The Mad Ghoul
3453.storyline: Evelyn Ankers hoped to do her own singing for the film, but because of the tight production schedule producer Ben Pivar used stock recordings of Lillian Cornell for the scenes in which Ankers' character sings (and the songs are obviously older recordings since their sound quality is inferior to the rest of the soundtrack).

3454.name: 20th Century Boys 1: Beginning of the End
3454.storyline: Followed by 20th Century Boys 2: The Last Hope (2009)

3456.name: Frankenstein's Daughter
3456.storyline: The full monster make-up was actually being worn by a man, Harry Wilson. Because of this, makeup creator Harry Thomas did not realize that the creature was supposed to be female. All he could do at the last minute was apply lipstick to the creature.

3457.name: Galaxis
3457.storyline: The film was originally considered to be a live-action feature film adaptation of the 1980s cartoon She-Ra: Princess of Power (1985). The film would had followed Hordak, as he leaves Etheria and arrives on Earth, as he seeks a mystical crystal, which was created at the beginning of time and She-Ra also arrives on Earth to stop him.

3458.name: World Gone Wild
3458.storyline: The original version implied that the dangerous cult based itself on one of the few books remaining after the holocaust: L. Ron Hubbard's "Dianetics." Lawyers for Scientology got wind of this and threatened to sue Apollo Pictures, who removed all references to Hubbard and Dianetics.

3459.name: Cosmic Dawn
3459.storyline: The used bookstore is called The Equinox, which is the same name as a volume of books, first printed in 1909, on magick [magic] by Aleister Crowley; The synonym magick is an archaic spelling of 'magic' used during the Renaissance and revived by Aleister Crowley to differentiate occult magic from stage magic.

3461.name: The Proud Family Movie
3461.storyline: During the run of the series, the character Wizard Kelly never had his face completely revealed. In this film, you can briefly see the whole of his face towards the end when the mess of peanut butter lands in the stadium and some of it falls on him and Uncle Bobby.

3462.name: Electric Dragon 80.000 V
3462.storyline: Narrator: The dragon. A mythological creature? No. It exists -- inside us.
