4085.storyline: Actress Naomi Navarre who's birth name is Torilena Fields was arrested October 9, 2024 and charged with murder, abuse of a corpse, tampering with physical evidence, torture of a dog or cat and obstructing governmental operations after apparently killing her mother, dismembering her and then cooking and eating parts of her.

4086.name: Dinotopia: Quest for the Ruby Sunstone
4086.storyline: The music that plays in the trailer is "Main Title (Trailer Music)" by APM Film Orchestra, which was also featured in the trailer for "Clifford's Really Big Movie (2004)".

4087.name: Beaster Day: Here Comes Peter Cottonhell
4087.storyline:
This film is a parody of Here Comes Peter Cottontail (1971)
and monster movies.

4088.name: Conan the Future Boy: The Big Giant Robot's Resurrection
4088.storyline: The film is a condensed version of the last three episodes of the "Future Boy Conan" anime.

4089.name: The Ship of Monsters
4089.storyline: The film's leading ladies, Ana Bertha Lepe and Lorena Velzquez, were crowned Seorita Mxico (Miss Mexico) in 1953 and 1960, respectively.

4090.name: Meteor
4090.storyline: I admit after 30 mins giving up on this one, so if things got great after that, well, fine. By that time however I had lost all interest and just nothing happened except for a girl running across a field. Coud not care less by this time what was going on no hook to draw you on and obviously the budget was $10 bucks. Avoid if you can.

4091.name: The Mad Doctor of Market Street
4091.storyline: Second-billed Lionel Atwill stars as Dr.Ralph Benson, but is listed in the end credits only under his alias, "Graham."

4092.name: The Cosmic Man
4092.storyline: While examining the sphere, an Air Force corporal places devices around the object. The devices are actually reflective grids used by film crews to adjust the lighting in specific parts of a shot.

4093.name: Mysterious Doctor Satan
4093.storyline: When this serial was being written, it was intended to be a series that utilized Superman as the main hero. The owners of Superman decided they didn't want to let the studio use the character. Instead of scraping the project altogether, the writers replaced Superman with a character of their own creation, called The Copperhead.

4095.name: Future-Kill
4095.storyline: A couple of different stories exist as to how H.R. Giger was persuaded to design the poster art for this low-budget film. Edwin Neal, who spent the 1980s traveling extensively to science fiction and movie conventions selling movie memorabilia, always claimed that he was the one responsible for getting Giger involved. However, in Giger's book "Necronomicon II," Giger says that director Ronald W. Moore was who he dealt with. Giger goes on to say that he felt manipulated by Moore, who told him in tears that the film would lose its financing without the Giger poster. Whatever the case, the original art did eventually end up in Neal's possession, along with numerous other prints and portfolios by Giger, lending credence to Neal's claims of involvement.

4096.name: Helldriver
4096.storyline: Produced and distributed in Japan along with Alien vs. Ninja (2010), Gokud heiki (2011) and Deadball (2011) as the second wave of Nikkatsu's Sushi Typhoon series of J-sploitation cinema.

4098.name: Battlefield: Fall of the World
4098.storyline: Of course I had never heard about this 2022 Chinese sci-fi action movie titled "Zhandi: Yzhong Haojie" (aka "Battlefield Fall of the World") prior to stumbling upon it here in 2024 by random chance. And of course I opted to sit down and watch it given the recent years flood of creature features that has been spewing forth from the Chinese cinema; some good, some not so good.Writers Dada Huang and Zhaosheng Huang put together an entertaining enough script for the movie. It is mindless entertainment, where you just grab your snack, lean back and enjoy the humans vs. Aliens action on the screen. There is very little to think about in the movie, and it doesn't make much of any sense; especially when you see how the aliens effortlessly tore through platoons of soldiers, and yet we are to believe that three sole survivors are capable of overcoming the alien overlord invasion. Sure...The narrative in the movie was dull and slow paced, so very, very slow paced. I ended up giving up on finish watching the movie about halfway through. By then I was just so bored with the lack of any real story progress, and the stale narrative, that I just didn't want to keep watching.I wasn't familiar with the cast ensemble in the movie, but the Chinese cast were nicely cast and put on good performances, whereas the non-Chinese cast put on mostly dubious and questionable performances, especially the platoon leader in the beginning of the movie.Visually then "Zhandi: Yzhong Haojie" was okay. The CGI effects are good, but of course not a match for the top of the line Hollywood productions. But for a Chinese movie such as this, then the effects were actually quite good.My rating of director Zhaosheng Huang's 2022 movie "Zhandi: Yzhong Haojie" lands on a four out of ten stars.

4099.name: The Brainiac
4099.storyline: This movie was referred to in the Frank Zappa/Captain Beefheart song Debra Kadabra from the album Bongo Fury.

4100.name: Dr. 56
4100.storyline: Priyamani returned to Tamil films after a long time

4101.name: The Creation of the Humanoids
4101.storyline: In the opening scene where they go through the the progression of robotic design, the robot shown as R1 is a prop left over from the 1956 movie "Earth vs the flying saucers". It's the same outfit worn by the invading aliens who piloted the flying saucers.

4102.name: Rise of the Zombies
4102.storyline: In one scene, it shows zombies climbing straight up the bridge pilings of the Golden Gate bridge. Not only are the zombies completely dry but they climb the bridge like spiders yet others in the same movie can't climb a 6 foot cyclone fence.

4103.name: Friendship's Death
4103.storyline: Sullivan: Could I made you blush ? Could I embarrass you ?Friendship: Can't blush. Got no liquids.Sullivan: Oh, you can't blush ? You've got no shame. You know that Darwin once said that blushing is the most human of responses. It doesn't occur anywhere else in the animal kingdom. It requires self-consciousness. It speaks of things that you may have admitted to yourself but you won't admit to others.Friendship: It's all to do with sex. Feeling flurried. Tingling. Glow. Enough to attract, not to intimidate. Blushing gives you away. It reveals your desires, your inadequacies. It's always sincere. That's why I can't blush. I can't be sincere.

4104.name: Project X
4104.storyline: Many of the stock "futuristic" sound effects are identical to those used on the original Star Trek series.

4105.name: Offworld: Alien Planet
4105.storyline: The character of Carrie Weaver gets her name from two legendary sci-fi actresses - Carrie Fisher and Sigourney Weaver.

4106.name: The Magnificent Raiders of Dimension War One
4106.storyline: From the cult classic "Pandoran Age Chronicles" novels by Dante D'Anthony.

4107.name: When Worlds Collide
4107.storyline: In the July 2009 issue of Fantastique magazine, director Sommers had the following to say in an interview: "Steven Spielberg and I have a great script for When Worlds Collide. We just have to wait now because of Roland Emmerich's 2012. It's too close a project."

4109.name: Mako: The Jaws of Death
4109.storyline: William Gref wrote the story for this film prior to Jaws (1975), but could not get anyone to finance it until after Jaws (1975) was a huge hit at the box office.

4110.name: Seuls
4110.storyline:
Bad film, i didn't like it
And it's not understandable
I lost my time watching it

4111.name: Dick Figures: The Movie
4111.storyline: The film was split into 12 chapters and was published onto YouTube by the film's secondary rights owner, co-producer and original distributor, Mondo Media, onto its YouTube channel, for those who cannot afford to pay for the film on digital streaming and download services.

4112.name: The Unseen
4112.storyline: Home is WhereWritten by Lana Cooney / Mint Bensimon / Isabelle BanosPerformed by Caveboy

4113.name: Red Water
4113.storyline: The sunken cars license plate is 'Louisiana 007 o 981' This plate is used in several shark films throughout the years. The first instance was when Hooper (Richard Dreyfuss) pulled it out a tiger shark in Jaws (1975). The same license was pulled in Deep Blue Sea (1999) by Carter Blake (Thomas Jane) from another tiger shark.

4114.name: Project Moon Base
4114.storyline: This was initially intended as a pilot film for a TV series to be called "Ring Around the Moon." When science-fiction movies suddenly became popular, producer Jack Seaman added enough footage to the film to bring it up to feature length. This was done without the knowledge of writer Robert A. Heinlein, and he disowned the result.

4115.name: Our Man in L.A.
4115.storyline: Did I just WATCH an audiobook? I get the idea of a story presentenced from the point of view of just one person, but the complete lack of any other people except for the main protagonist is bizarre and feels weird. The movie shows literally one person all the time and he's constantly talking on the phone with various people, so as the story unfolds, we only HEAR it. We hear some voices, sometimes we see some parts of other people's bodies, but there is never any physical interaction (well, there is one, but no spoilers here). There is just one guy running around, driving his car or a bicycle and he's calling someone non-stop.Also, the color grading is pushing the film into the Mexican territory. I mean, everything is so yellow and unnatural looking. But it's supposed to be L. A.I didn't enjoy the film. I've had a feeling that something is missing, although I liked the theme of recovering parts of alien tech from the sea. I guess there is a lot of potential in this idea. Just poorly executed here.

4116.name: CQ
4116.storyline: After being fired, Andrezej puts his fist through the screening room door. This is a reference to Francis Ford Coppola (father of director Roman Coppola) and his short temper. When the editors get a framed section of the destroyed wall, it is actually a portion of a wall the elder Coppola wrecked in his early directing days.

4117.name: Radar Men from the Moon
4117.storyline: During a fight scene between George D. Wallace as Commando Cody and Clayton Moore as the villain Graber, Wallace zigged when he should have zagged, and Moore connected with him and broke his nose.

4118.name: The Resonator: Miskatonic U
4118.storyline: At 51:55 Crawford states, "That will be quite enough of that." Which is the same thing Jeffrey Combs says as Crawford Tillinghast in From Beyond (1986).

4119.name: Attack of the Corn Zombies
4119.storyline: This was a top notch horror film! Zombie films are hard to do on an indie budget, let alone a period piece film. This film pulls both off great! The town looks vintage, and they were able to even get some classic cars. The zombies had some legit SFX to them and not the typical gray face makeup. It boasted a large cast and each group had their own subplot so it was not just having people around for zombie bait. Just a good amount of comedy keeps part of the film light, but the film gets harsh and gory when it needs to. The story is witty and does take cues form other zombie films but does so by honoring them.A film like this should be on the radar of the larger horror community. It was on Shudder or the likes, it would blow up. It reminds me of the zombie film The Dead Next Door in the 90s. The production team at Acrostar films deserves all the awards and praise it has gotten for this film. Good job! Can't wait for the sequel.

4120.name: The Area 51 Incident
4120.storyline: Needless to say that I had actually never heard about this 2022 horror sci-fi movie titled "The Area 51 Incident", prior to stumbling upon it by random chance here in 2024. And of course, with it being a horror movie of sorts, and a movie that I hadn't already seen, then I opted to sit down and give director Rhys Frake-Waterfield's 2022 movie a fair chance.Truth be told, I virtually had no idea what I was in for here. So writers Tom Jolliffe, Rhys Frake-Waterfield and Scott Chambers had every opportunity readily available to impress and entertain me with "The Area 51 Incident". But I have to admit that I wasn't really harboring the biggest of expectations to the movie, given the movie's dubious cover.The storyline was pretty straightforward, but actually at the same time it wasn't anything overly noteworthy or particularly interesting. It was a rather mundane, if not actually bland, script and storyline that the writers concocted for the movie. Sort of a very standard alien invasion type of movie, in the likes of "Alien", except not as entertaining or memorable. The movie was sort of a clich, in lack of better words. Sort of think if "The Strain" and "Alien" had a baby, then this movie would be it, except it didn't prove nowhere as interesting or entertaining as neither of them.I wasn't familiar with a single actor or actress on the cast list, I will say that the acting performances were actually fair, despite the fact that the script and material they had to work with was mundane.The CGI animated aliens in the movie looked rather questionable, and that somewhat took away from the overall enjoyment of the movie. Alien movies such as this needs proper effects to be effective, and having subpar CGI effects just really doesn't cut it for me.While I did manage to endure through the entire 81 minutes that the movie ran for, I was not overly impressed or particularly entertained by director Rhys Frake-Waterfield's 2022 movie. And it is definitely not a movie that I will ever return to watch again. Nor is it a movie that I would recommend for diehard sci-fi fans to sit down and watch.My rating of "The Area 51 Incident" lands on a three out of ten stars. Points awarded for the sheer effort they put into this project.

4121.name: Diamantino
4121.storyline: Lead star Carloto Cotta said that to play a soccer superstar (loosely inspired by Cristiano Ronaldo), he did not take additional soccer lessons but instead worked with a personal trainer to develop highly-defined six pack abs - something Ronaldo is famous for. Cotta worked out for months in advance following a strict training regime and diet that had him eating almost no carbs. He noted, "It is very hard to get abs like that." But the training paid off and the film-makers complimented Cotta for achieving the shredded physique of a soccer star. In the film, Cotta constantly appears shirtless and shows off his abs, much like the soccer star he is based on.

4122.name: The Gene Generation
4122.storyline: Michelle: Believe me, from where I come from, death is just an upgrade.

4123.name: Love Story 2050
4123.storyline: Debut film of Harman Baweja who was dubbed as a clone of Hrithik Roshan.

4124.name: Soulmates
4124.storyline: Over the years, "Soulmates," which originally was titled "Sweet Dreamers" was optioned by Diane Ladd, MGM-Pathe' of Dan Andresen & Paul Bagley . However, James was adamant about portraying the lead character of Steph, claiming that this project was his "Rocky." Moreover, James never sold the Rights to "Soulmates" with the intention of Directing the project, with actor Jadon Cal, his son, playing the role of Steph.

4125.name: Evil Bong 3: The Wrath of Bong
4125.storyline: The first theatrical release from Full Moon Pictures.

4126.name: Dead Sea
4126.storyline: Originally conceived as more of a mystery/thriller, certain scenes, such as the attack on the pontoon boat and the brief nudity, were added to the script days before production at the request of the distributor.

4127.name: Asylum of Darkness
4127.storyline: The last film Richard Hatch completed before his death. Hatch started other films, some of which were completed, but his part in those films was less than intended due to his dying before those films were completed.

4128.name: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
4128.storyline: This production originally began shooting with Jason Robards in the title role(s), and a makeup that was heavily influenced by John Barrymore in the 1920 silent version (Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (1920)). Production was halted due to a strike, and when filming was able to resume, Robards was no longer available. Jack Palance took over the Jekyll/Hyde role, and the makeup concept was radically changed - inspired, more or less, by that of a satyr.

4129.name: Anatar
4129.storyline: This film inspired several other films to be created such as Star Wars and Avatar. Those films went on to be wildly successful and defined the sci-fi genre.

4130.name: When Women Rule the World
4130.storyline: After Michael's car breaks down, several times the camera shot from behind his head shows movements different than those from the front.

4131.name: Alienated
4131.storyline: Daryl Anka is the person who channels the extraterrestrial entity, Bashar. Many of the plot points are directly from Bashar's messages. For example, Bashar has said, about 40 years ago, that movement through space was done because everything in space time has a vibration which includes a location component Superimpose a different location vibration on an object and that object just moves to the new location. He said an experiment might be performed with sensitive enough equipment. Take a copper sphere and tap it so that it vibrates, and record the vibration. Repeat in a new location. Move the object back to the first location, and after separating out the location component of the vibration, subject the copper sphere to the second location vibration and the sphere will move to the new location.

4132.name: The Drone
4132.storyline: If you stop at 1:01:22 you can see the photo the Drones sends. It looks like a mock Snapchat and has written 'courtesy flush'

4133.name: Atomica
4133.storyline: Many scenes in the movie were filmed in a cold war, 1960s era Titan I underground missile silo in eastern Washington state. In some scenes where the lead character is creating video log entries, a diagram of a Titan I installation appears in the upper right (3 missile silos, 2 satellite silos, and the equipment and operation domes, all connected by tunnels).

4134.name: Invader
4134.storyline: With a make up as you go plot, "Invader" loses all credibility, and believability by the ten minute mark, after which you will be wondering what is going on, or better yet, you won't care what is going on. There is nothing endearing about a non-script micro budget film that tests your patience. It is not strange, it is not a cult film candidate, what it is, is a mess of a movie. The acting, effects, and everything else, reeks of "let's finish this thing", no matter if it makes any sense, let's just get it finished. Beware, "Invader" will not meet your expectations for a low budget sci-fi, because there is really no story being told. It is simply a mish-mash of bad acting, bad script, and marginal special effects. - MERK

4135.storyline: At 0:04:16, a gentleman is in the back of a pickup firing a .30 caliber machine gun which has no belt being fed in to it and no empty cartridge's being ejected.

4137.name: The Mad Monster
4137.storyline: George Zucco's estate set was reused by the cost-conscious set designers at PRC for Zucco's crypt in Dead Men Walk (1943).

4140.name: MindGamers
4140.storyline: The film was released via Fathom Events for one night only. While this live event of simultaneous screenings took place, 1,000 people from the movie theater audience participated in an experiment by wearing a cognition headband. These headbands enabled scientists to capture the cognition state of the participants simultaneously via cloud technology and collect data in real time. The result was a world-first image of a mass-mind state (the likes and scale of which has never been attempted).

4141.name: Boy 7
4141.storyline: The subway scenes and most of the city scenes were shot in Budapest.

4142.name: Renegades: Ominara
4142.storyline: This will be the final Star Trek performance by Nichelle Nichols.

4143.name: Kill Order
4143.storyline: The name that appears in the titles in the movie is "Killing Soldier-der Krieger". Probably it is one and the same movie, that title is for German version, and "Kill Order" is the title for English version.

4144.name: The Tomorrow Job
4144.storyline: I'm not sure how this movie has even the meager rating that it does, because it was so patently unwatchable. Absurd plot with Dr. Who type one-dimensional characters pulling the strings behind the scenes along with wooden acting of stereotypical roles. The biggest insult to the viewer was the rushed and convoluted Hail Mary ending. Only a couple of the actors were palatable out of the entire cast. I got the feeling a high school film student could have done better on an iphone. All told, there was not a single redeeming quality to this film other than it was a distraction while I prepared dinner on a week night. In retrospect, however, I probably should have turned on some music. Take a pass on this one.

4145.name: Kaw
4145.storyline: Rod Taylor appeared in Hitchcock's 'The Birds'

4147.name: Jesse James Meets Frankenstein's Daughter
4147.storyline: The laboratory equipment that was used in the film was provided by Ken Strickfaden, who originally used the same equipment in both Frankenstein (1931) and Bride of Frankenstein (1935), as well as years later in Young Frankenstein (1974). This is the first Frankenstein film to feature the equipment in the story in several years and the first of the few times that it was filmed in color.

4148.name: Switch
4148.storyline: Released in China as a 122-minute theatrical cut, whilst released in Hong Kong as a 113-minute theatrical cut. The Hong Kong cut loses a backstory of a little peasant girl that hangs around Xiao Jinhan's swamp hideout.

4149.name: Frankenstein Meets the Spacemonster
4149.storyline: Written by Virginia-based university writers R.H.W. Dillard, George Garrett and John Rodenbeck, this film was originally conceived as a comedy and a parody of the science fiction and horror genres, but the producers, while they were amused, wanted a serious science fiction/horror film instead. Comedic elements from the film's script that were cut from it included Col. Frank Saunders/Frankenstein being partially made from transplanted human parts, including the legs of a dead tap dancer (and, as a result, whenever he heard the song "Sweet Georgia Brown" he would immediately start to tap dance and not stop, no matter what the situation was).

4150.name: The Mind Snatchers
4150.storyline: The film in the English language has had a number of titles. These include: The Mind Snatchers, The Happiness Cage, Mindsnatcher, Brain Control, Mind Snatcher, The Demon Within, Mind Snatchers, and The Mind Snatcher.

4152.name: Neon Fear
4152.storyline: Robert Bess, Kevin Duffy, Robert Todd Kennedy, Rudy Ledbetter, Kris Smith, George Tounas and Manny Weathers all appeared together in Desert Fiends (2024)

4153.name: The Man Who Saved the World
4153.storyline: The material from Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977) was spliced in from an anamorphic print, while this movie was shot in academy format, which put the Star Wars footage in the wrong aspect ratio. The Death Star looks more like a Death Egg.

4154.name: Pros and Cons of Being Single
4154.storyline: Took more than 3 years to complete pre-production, filming and post-production. This is largely due to the COVID pandemic.

4156.name: Pokmon the Movie: Secrets of the Jungle
4156.storyline: We've rounded up every anime series and movie we could find  created or distributed by Netflix  to see which ones rank the highest, according to IMDb users.

4157.name: Centrespread
4157.storyline: This film is considered an "Ozploitation" (Australian exploitation) picture. The category is used for post-1971 low-budget comedy, horror, and action films many of which had an R (18+) rating classification and this includes 'Centrespread'. The Australian DVD release of 'Centrespread' (1981) has on the front cover of the slick the ''Ozploitation Classics'' series logo.

4158.name: Tobor the Great
4158.storyline: The original Tobor prop and remote control device is still in existence, having been stored away safely in a private collection for more than 50 years.

4159.name: Monster High: Freaky Fusion
4159.storyline: Sparky Frankenstein: It's alive! IT'S ALIVE!... I really hope it's alive. It's so embarrassing when it's not alive.

4161.name: Bela Lugosi Meets a Brooklyn Gorilla
4161.storyline: In his research and preparation for playing Bela Lugosi in Ed Wood (1994), the biopic of cult director Edward D. Wood Jr., Martin Landau watched this film three times stunned, saying that it was so bad "it made the Ed Wood films look like Gone with the Wind (1939)".

4162.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: The Afterglow of Zeon
4162.storyline: Edited from Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory (1991)

4163.name: .com for Murder
4163.storyline: In 2002, Emerson Bixby fired his manager for claiming this was an "excellent film." Bixby's next script referenced a character named Mastorakis (name of the director) who was arrested for breaking into zoos and molesting animals.

4164.name: High Stitches
4164.storyline: The light in the fridge is still working, despite the power cut due to the tanker accident during the night.

4165.name: The Mind's Eye
4165.storyline: The set for the interrogation scene was built in a garage.

4166.name: The Poof Point
4166.storyline: Mark Curry and Dawn Lewis appeared together in the sitcom Hangin' with Mr. Cooper.

4167.name: Mandrake
4167.storyline: After Santiago saves McCall, hes injured. Later they opt to field dress his wound. Blonde Dr says, "being in so many 3rd world countries you learn how to dress wounds." "I need to stop the bleeding give me your belt."She then applies the tourniquet, below the wound. Which if anything, would make him bleed faster. Tourniquets always go between the wound and the heart.

4168.name: Chosen Survivors
4168.storyline: Bats were caught in nets on a daily basis for use in this movie. Moreover, said captured bats were only used for a single day and alas many of them died throughout the production of the film. As a direct result of this latter occurrence, both Jackie Cooper and Barbara Babcock subsequently spoke to the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences about universalizing the methods of treating animals in a humane fashion in American movies shot in other countries.

4169.name: Tornado Warning
4169.storyline: Also titled as Alien Tornado on SyFy channel

4170.name: Rebirth of Mothra
4170.storyline: Desghidorah's elephant-like roar is sped up and high-pitched in order to reuse it for Cretaceous King Ghidorah from Rebirth of Mothra 3 and Orga in the Japanese version of Godzilla 2000.

4171.name: Lobster Man from Mars
4171.storyline: In his autobiography, Tony Curtis says that he worked on the movie because they paid him $100,000, and he needed to make child support payments. He also mentions that during the production, he never saw the scenes of the movie that his character was reacting to.

4172.name: P1H: The Beginning of a New World
4172.storyline: This film can be viewed on several levels: modern action or modern action for the "thinking person". Rated a nine bc it was somewhat confusing with many switches from the past, current and future world. That being said, the thinking person will be very impressed with the total package. A great analogy for our time early 21st century) done with great style and technical expertise.

4173.name: Tetsuo: The Bullet Man
4173.storyline: The only "Tetsuo" film in which male genitalia isn't shown.

4174.name: The Police Are Blundering in the Dark
4174.storyline: The movie was originally shot in 1972 under the title "Il giardino delle lattughe" (=The salad garden), but not released until 1975 when it was retitled "The Police Are Blundering in the Dark", a title that was possibly chosen because at that time 'poliziotteschi films' were more popular than 'giallo films'.

4175.name: Planet of the Apes: Rule the Planet

4176.name: Digimon Adventure tri. Part 6: Future
4176.storyline: Kari Kamiya: Tai, if you destroy Meicoomon, I'll never forgive you. But you're still my brother, and if you think this is the only way, then I'll battle alongside you.

4177.name: Doomsday: The Sinking of Japan
4177.storyline: Final acting role of Tetsur Tamba.

4178.name: Dark Storm
4178.storyline: Filming for some scenes took place at the now-defunct Canadian Armed Forces base in Sardis, the southern area of Chilliwack. Certain scenes were filmed at a satellite secondary-school campus (Sardis Secondary School) located in one of the buildings.

4179.name: Y2K
4179.storyline: The film takes place from December 31, 1999 to January 1, 2000.

4180.name: Creatures
4180.storyline: Who else might combine aliens, zombies and furry little gremlins? The acting and camerawork in this film aren't bad, but everything else is, especially the story itself, along with the editing, which lacks the timing that might have make it work as a "so bad it's good" movie- it's not. Save your hour (or however much you could take) for something better. Pretty much anything.

4181.name: The Kovak Box
4181.storyline: (at around 42 mins) The amount of froth in David's bottle varies during his conversation with Silvia at the bar.

4182.name: End of the World
4182.storyline: At about 12 minutes, the Army is unloading a C-141. It's obviously being filmed at March Air Museum. You can see prop planes right next to the C-141.

4183.name: The Gateway
4183.storyline: At the beginning of the film, they increase the power to their experiment to 150 petawatts, eventually reaching 350 petawatts, this is a ridiculously high amount. In 2012 the worldwide energy production was roughly 21 petawatt hours. To put this into perspective, the entire worldwide energy supply in 2012 would be able to power their experiment for around 1 second.

4184.name: Bakterion
4184.storyline: For some reason, at some point in the 21st century, the film became regarded as public domain in America. Floods of inferior-quality releases have been floating around the market, usually sourced from the original Gorgon Video VHS. It was eventually given a proper Blu-ray release from Code Red in 2016.

4185.name: War of the Satellites
4185.storyline: From the time this movie was conceived, it was reportedly only eight weeks later that the completed movie was playing in theatres.

4188.name: 2307: Winter's Dream
4188.storyline: A data pad used at multiple times including the briefing scene at the beginning, has symbols on it that are the same alphabet used in the Star Wars universe.

4191.name: Ice Spiders
4191.storyline: Thomas Calabro, Patrick Muldoon and Vanessa Williams previously starred together in the hit TV series Melrose Place (1992).

4192.name: The Long Walk
4192.storyline: At 43:59, the left leg of the laying corpse is slightly falling down against the ground.

4193.name: Nemesis 5: The New Model
4193.storyline: The conclusion of the Nemesis story.

4195.name: Gog
4195.storyline: The robots Gog and Magog were operated by little people.

4197.name: It Came from the Desert
4197.storyline: The narrator at the beginning of the movie says the exact thing that is said at the beginning of the computer game.

4198.name: Psycho-Pass: Providence
4198.storyline: This film celebrate 10th Anniversary of Psycho-Pass anime series.

4199.name: Super Shark
4199.storyline: Before the opening credits, the finale from megashark vs crocosaurus is shown.

4200.name: Puppet Master X: Axis Rising
4200.storyline: Even though this is the eleventh Puppet Master film, it's been titled as the tenth because Puppet Master vs Demonic Toys (2004) is not considered to be part of the series, as according to Charles Band.

4201.name: The People
4201.storyline: The drawings that the children are suppose to have drawn are actually by artist Arthur Okamura.

4202.name: Collision Earth
4202.storyline: Gwen is drilling into the meteor with a battery powered drill with no battery installed .

4203.name: Dinocroc
4203.storyline: Roger Corman approached the SyFy channel with an idea for a sequel, which they turned down for fear of it being a total bomb, so Corman scrapped it until 2007 when it was reintroduced as a new film called Supergator, which he produced. as well as the 2010 sequel to both films, Dinocroc vs. Supergator.

4204.name: Land of Doom
4204.storyline: Deborah Rennard and Daniel Radell's movie debut - but co-star Garrick Dowhen's final movie. 4th-billed Frank Garret only made this movie in his career (as of 2020).

4206.name: Battle for Pandora
4206.storyline: I can only imagine that anyone having anything to do with this abomination and actually releasing it upon the American public is currently seeking out a deep dark remote part of this world to hide in shame, remorse and the deep guilt one would undoubtely feel after creating something such as this and calling it a "Movie".If you paid for this garbage, you have been legally mugged.Most of the actors are young and have a chance for redemption providing their families, friends and the movie industry acknowledge their existence again.The older actors no longer care or have any pride in their trade knowing the fact that the American people are being dumbed down enogh to accept this rubbish and just shut up.Hopefully I didn't hurt anyone's feeeeliiingsss.

4207.name: Shangri-La: Near Extinction
4207.storyline: This movie really feels like it was meant to be the pilot for some new series. It has this odd intro spiel that's more common for a series, then it ends in a wind-up as if it's getting ready to start episode 2. But of course there aren't any episodes to follow. I'm guessing this was supposed to be a new series and it never got picked up.As a standalone movie it's not good. The acting is very forced and wooden. The dialog feels flat and scripted instead of flowing. The special effects are cringe worthy.It's an interesting idea, but needs work.

4209.name: Heavenquest: A Pilgrim's Progress
4209.storyline:
First of all, abusing the title of John Bunyan's book " A Pilgrim's Progress" doesn't make your movie great, doesn't make it look like it is the same story, and it definately is not alike that story.
Much in this movie is not Christian at all. Seems they prefer to please the world rather than bring a genuine Christian "fantasty" movie. A "fabled good king"? Meaning God?
The acting, the special effects, the story, it is all bad as can be. And much in this movie is more from the evil side than from the good side.
The only good work is the cinematography/camerawork. Some may see this as finally a "Christian fantasy" movie, but the last part is more present than the first one. Avoid it if you can.

4210.name: The Circuit: Star Crew
4210.storyline: A number of the actors involved in this project previously were billed co-stars of shows in the Star Trek: The Next Generation universe (DS9/Voyager).

4211.name: Pulse Pounders
4211.storyline: Originally shot during 1987/88, the film was unfortunately caught up in the financial wranglings that followed the collapse of Empire Pictures. The movie has been shelved since that time, although it was screened once on 11 August 2012, at Chicago Flashback Weekend Horror Convention. Excluding that, the film has apparently never been shown.

4212.name: Goodbye, 20th Century
4212.storyline: Macedonia's official submission for Best Foreign Language Film at the 71st Academy Awards.

4213.name: Persona 3 the Movie: #1 Spring of Birth
4213.storyline: The background score is music from the video game.

4214.name: Habitat
4214.storyline: This is the only theatrical movie filmed in Sony's early analog High Definition format. Sony donated the equipment and technical support in an attempt to popularize the format. The High Definition video was then transferred to film for release.

4215.name: The Bloodettes
4215.storyline: I have seen Les Saignantes 3 times and each time like it more. It helps to know Africa a bit when you see it, because Bekolo is not trying to make the usual huts-and-boubous-film, but is trying to show the emotional realities of living in a corrupt, polluted, city where prostitution is rife and idealism is punished. The censorship board of Cameroon has not yet decided whether to censor it, supposedly for its sexual content but probably for its political stands. It's a pretty direct commentary on Cameroon's present government. I think the film misses its aims slightly, but that's because he was trying to do too much. He wants to show women prevailing, daring to fight back, to stand up, and he wants to adapt an African ritual (mevungu) in a modern form. He wants to make a political statement in a time when it's dangerous or irrelevant to do so. I still don't exactly get the turns of the plot, but I don't think the plot's that important. I enjoyed the images, even the MTV-ish ones, I enjoyed the references to other films, and I enjoyed the slapstick butchery, stuff you won't see in any other African film by any one else.

4217.name: Viking
4217.storyline: Award: Special mention at the Toronto International Film Festival (2022)

4218.name: Gas! -Or- It Became Necessary to Destroy the World in Order to Save It.
4218.storyline: The film's subtitle comes from an alleged statement of a U.S. Army Major (name unknown) during the Vietnam War who was said to have defended the complete and total destruction of both a Vietnamese town and everyone and everything in it at the hands of Army soldiers who were acting on his orders by supposedly saying "It became necessary to destroy the town to save it."

4219.name: E noi come stronzi rimanemmo a guardare
4219.storyline: I watched this film with pleasure.It is not a real masterpiece, but looking at it I realized how much everything that happens can be more than realistic and this makes us think.I honestly recommend you to watch it :)

4220.name: Gamera the Brave
4220.storyline: When little Toto/Gamera is crawling thru the kitchen, a knife falls off a table and sticks in the floor in such a way as to resemble Guiron, the monster Gamera fought in Gamera vs. Guiron (1969).

4221.name: Five Weeks in a Balloon
4221.storyline: Billy Gilbert's final film. He retired from acting after this role.

4222.name: Throwback Holiday
4222.storyline: Throwback holidayWritten by Daryl Simmons and Donald R. Atkins Jr.

4223.name: Invasion: UFO
4223.storyline: Edited together from episodes of the TV series UFO (1970).

4224.name: Fire Twister
4224.storyline: The line " kill them, kill them all" used before they fired on the fire truck was used by Casper Van Dien in Starship Troopers.

4225.name: Independence Daysaster
4225.storyline: The movie was shot in fifteen days.

4226.name: Incident at Loch Ness
4226.storyline: Zak Penn and Werner Herzog perform the DVD commentary while still in character, trading insults frequently, scolding each other and referring to a fake legal agreement that presumably would have been reached after the events of the film take place. Their argument gets so heated that Herzog 'leaves' and the commentary stops and then restarts, this time hosted by Penn and producer Jana Augsberger.

4228.name: Pacfico
4228.storyline: Pacifico is the biggest SCI FI movie made in Latin America.

4229.name: Peripheral
4229.storyline: Really weird in a David Cronenberg meets Bernard Rose kind of way, this low budget Brit movie has its merits and is worth watching if only for its 'what the hell was that all about?' feeling you get at the end. Good cameo from Tom Conti who probably came in from a long lunch to do the scene.

4230.name: Jango
4230.storyline: It definitely is an interesting/gripping concept but the execution, actors, cinematography, music aka overall making was very poor and didn't support much to the strong concept, If it'd have supported, then this film might've become one of those best sci-fi films from India for sure. At least the repeating sequences should've been fastened to make the screenplay a bit faster.Still, it is good for a one-time watch for sci-fi lovers like me. Very much related to Maanadu but with very few commercial elements.

4231.name: Adrenalin: Fear the Rush
4231.storyline: Several versions of the film are in distribution. The official US version is 76 minutes long. There is a European/UK (Polygram) version that is 102 minutes long. Director/writer Albert Pyun has said in interviews he intends to restore and release a 110 minutes Director's Cut restoration of the film. This version is set entirely in Romania and has only a minor virus aspect in its plot.

4232.name: And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
4232.storyline: Both Susan Gibney and Kelly Packard made their feature film debuts in this movie.

4233.name: Beyond the Edge
4233.storyline: The main hallway changes from a round shape to a coffin shape late in the film as the crew experiences the multiverse.

4234.name: Ice Soldiers
4234.storyline: The song during the end credits is Ne Budi by Lion.

4235.name: Codename: Kids Next Door - Operation Z.E.R.O.
4235.storyline: Father almost became the antihero of the film, after finally snapping at Grandfather for always putting him down and favoring Monty. However, he gives up after realizing that there's no point; even if he beat up Grandfather, he still wouldn't respect him.

4236.name: Kong Island
4236.storyline: Although the U.S. version of the film was advertised under the title "King of Kong Island", its actual on-screen title is "Kong Island," even though the film has nothing to do with King Kong.

4237.name: Pizza Man
4237.storyline: In Adam West's cameo appearance, he makes two references from his acting career: He first makes three nods to his iconic role from the 1966 Batman TV show ("My car is stuck in a cave. Its a long story.", "...I'm not very fond of clowns", & "Back in the day I would have kapow right in the face."). And then he makes a nod to his role from Family Guy ("As mayor of this fair city...").

4238.name: The Adventures of Captain Zoom in Outer Space
4238.storyline: Cathy Moriarty played the voice of the robot "Alimina"

4239.name: Untitled Grant Sputore/Legendary Monsterverse Project
4239.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

4240.name: To Every You I've Loved Before
4240.storyline: This film and its parallel tale To the Solitary Me Who Loved You (2022), both about parallel worlds, share the same release date of October 7 2022Similarly, Yomoji Otono's novel adaptations of "Boku ga Aishita Subete no Kimi e" and "Kimi o Aishita Hitori no Boku e" released on the same date of June 23 2016.

4241.name: Gundala
4241.storyline: Gundala is a part of Jagad Sinema BumiLangit (BumiLangit Cinematic Universe), a new superhero franchise in Indonesia who bring back a thousands of Indonesia's classic supeheroes character, BumiLangit Universe based on BumiLangit Comic (Indonesia's superhero/Gundala comics publisher)

4242.name: Atlantis: The Lost Continent
4242.storyline: Following a preview of the film, a questionnaire was distributed among the viewers asking what scene they liked. One person answered, "The scene where Robert Taylor saved Deborah Kerr from the fire." This was in reference to the fact that much of the stock footage used in the film came from Quo Vadis (1951).

4243.name: Watch Movie Free Online
4243.storyline: Edited and voice recorded in 3 hours from different unreleased frames from Sergey A. computer.

4244.name: Griff the Invisible
4244.storyline: The multi button phones seen in the office scenes are Exicom BT-450 ISDN phones. Exicom went bankrupt many years ago and these phones popped up later on the Tennyson SOX PABX but were dark grey rather than white.

4245.name: Portal
4245.storyline: This will actually happen as J.J. Abrams and Gabe Newell were already talking about it, they finally concluded that they will make both a Portal and a Half-Life movie.

4246.name: Crash of Moons
4246.storyline: Crash of Moons (1954 TV Movie) was the feature flick in Season 5, Episode 17 of Mystery Science Theater 3000 (1988-1999); it originally aired on November 28, 1992.

4247.name: Capture the Flag
4247.storyline: NASA astronauts Alan Bean and Miguel Lpez-Alegra are technical advisors. Bean was the fourth man to walk on the moon with Apollo XII's voyage in November, 1969. Alegra was the first Spanish astronaut to travel outer space.

4248.name: Hard to Be a God
4248.storyline: The main requirement Strugatsky for the film was the presence of a Soviet director, preferably Alexei Herman, but the director was approved Fleischman. Because of its intractability and serious nature, the Strugatsky stopped monitoring the process of filming and, as a result, they did not like the resulting film.

4249.name: Big Man Japan
4249.storyline: Despite premiering at the Cannes Film Festival, the film was not released theatrically in France, going instead straight to DVD.

4250.name: She Devil
4250.storyline: The 'insect' that the doctors look at through the microscope is clearly a drawing and does not look the least bit like a fruit fly.

4252.name: Day of Reckoning
4252.storyline: A news report says that the US president has recommended a new branch of the Department of Homeland Security, the DHS. DHS is the Department of Homeland Security, and in 2021 employed 230,000 people.

4253.name: Exo-Man
4253.storyline: Often mistaken for a 70's Iron Man Movie.

4254.name: Duke Nukem
4254.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

4255.name: Embers
4255.storyline: To understand how the characters' memory loss would manifest, writer and director Claire Carr researched Henry Mollison, who had his hippocampus removed as part of an experimental brain surgery to treat his epilepsy and then couldn't form any new memories for the rest of his life. She also researched Clive Wearing, a UK musician and composer who developed retrograde and anterograde amnesia after contracting a virus. Wearing is unable to form any lasting new memories; his memory "resets" after approximately 30 seconds, and he often thinks he just woke up from a coma.

4256.name: Pokmon the Movie: Kyurem vs. the Sword of Justice
4256.storyline: This is the first film in the series to not have Team Rocket get involved with the plot.

4257.name: The Noah's Ark Principle
4257.storyline: The most expensive (about 1.2 million DM) student film in Germany.

4258.name: Auggie
4258.storyline: Auggie: I know everything about you, Felix.[laughs] Auggie: Relax, I'm... I'm just kidding. Well, kind of.[laughs]

4259.name: The Human Race
4259.storyline: Filming took place over a 4 year period. Initially the film shot for 7 days, then took a 3 month break. Then it shot for another 2 days and another 3 month break. The shooting schedule continued like this until the film was complete.

4260.name: In the Dust of the Stars
4260.storyline: According to director of photography Peter Sring, the scenes in Romania (mud volcanoes and salt mines) were the first to be shot. The film laboratory at the Romanian National Film Studios in Buftea were used to processing Eastman Kodak stock, and were initially unable to process the East German ORWO negative. After re-calibrating the Romanian lab equipment, it was able to process the ORWO stock, albeit with a soft contrast look that the director and DP liked. As a result, all of the footage subsequently shot at the Babelsberg Studios in East Germany was shipped on a daily basis to Romania for processing.

4261.name: Avenging Force: The Scarab
4261.storyline: The character Bart Hill goes by the code-name Double Dare in the movie. His original comic incarnation was known as Daredevil. However, due to licensing issues with Marvel's hero of the same name, this version uses the code-name that comic writer Roy Thomas gave Hill during the series Alter Ego in the mid 1980's.

4262.name: Alien Invasion
4262.storyline: The police car license plate says "Tetis County Police, Republic of Somewhere"

4263.name: The Substitute
4263.storyline: The earth globe seen from space in the beginning and the end of the film is falsely mirrored.

4264.name: Rana: The Legend of Shadow Lake

4265.name: Barbie: Star Light Adventure
4265.storyline: In an attempt to heal the nation, on February 14, 2021, podcast hosts Richard Martin and Alexander "AJ" Jones of the Cult Popture Podcast released an 18+ hour comprehensive podcast reviewing the 37 Barbie films. The retrospective took over a month to prepare and features numerous guest speakers as well as an original song created specially for the podcast.

4267.name: Lego Star Wars Terrifying Tales
4267.storyline: Matt Sloan, who voices Darth Vader, became well known amongst Youtubers as Darth's "brother" Chad Vader in Chad Vader: Day Shift Manager.

4268.name: Hot Wheels
4268.storyline: McG and Juan Carlos Fresnadillo were set to direct the movie.

4269.name: Untitled Ben 10 Project
4269.storyline: The first Ben 10 movie to release in cinemas rather than airing on Cartoon Network.

4270.name: 2 Lava 2 Lantula!
4270.storyline: The inside joke of a couple who appeared during Steve Guttenberg's inspirational speech ("There are no aliens in Florida") are Tahnee Welch and Tyrone Power, Jr., who appeared to be reprising their roles from Cocoon (1985) and Cocoon: The Return (1988), which also starred Guttenberg.

4271.name: Attack of the Puppet People
4271.storyline: This was broadcast on television as a late-night movie on the evening of June 17, 1972, during the notorious Watergate burglary in Washington DC. If Alfred C. Baldwin III (who was watching this film in his room of the nearby Howard Johnsons hotel across the street as a lookout for the Watergate burglars) had not been so engrossed in a broadcast of this film, he might have sooner warned his colleagues of the three plainclothes police detectives who arrived at the building and made the historic arrests.

4272.name: Generation P
4272.storyline: Konstantin Khabenskiy turned down the role of Babylen Tatarsky. Than it went with Vladimir Epifantsev.

4273.name: Red Billabong
4273.storyline: Sophie dons first role was on Luke's Sparkes 'yesterday is history'

4274.name: Lancelot: Guardian of Time
4274.storyline: Like A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court (1921), A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court (1949), Unidentified Flying Oddball (1979), Doctor Who: Battlefield: Part One (1989), A Kid in King Arthur's Court (1995) and The Wonderful World of Disney: A Knight in Camelot (1998). The film is a time travel story that centers around the Legend of King Arthur.

4275.name: Terminal Invasion
4275.storyline: Without any marketing, the film unexpectedly became the third highest rated original movie on the Sci-Fi Channel at the time of its release. This lead to the network negotiating with star Bruce Campbell to produce and direct his own film, Man with the Screaming Brain (2005), which had been in production hell for twenty years.

4276.name: The Hideous Sun Demon
4276.storyline: Upon its release, the film received mostly negative reviews. By the 1980s, it became something of a cult film to horror and B-movie film fans. In 1983, an authorized, re-edited comedic spoof version entitled What's Up, Hideous Sun Demon (1989) (also known as Revenge of the Sun Demon) was released. The film's star and producer Robert Clarke agreed to re-dub his dialogue for the spoof, but reportedly later regretted being involved in the production. In 1985, Hideous Sun Demon: Special Edition was released.

4277.name: Returner
4277.storyline: The name of the aliens in this film, the "Daggra", is the Tibetan word for "Enemy".

4278.name: End of the World
4278.storyline: Sir Christopher Lee has said about this movie: "Some of the films I've been in I regret making. I got conned into making these pictures in almost every case by people who lied to me. Some years ago, I got a call from my producers saying that they were sending me a script and that five very distinguished American actors were also going to be in the film. Actors like Jos Ferrer, Dean Jagger, and John Carradine. So I thought "Well, that's all right by me". But it turned out it was a complete lie. Appropriately, the film was called End Of The World."

4280.name: Gappa the Triphibian Monster
4280.storyline: The main and end title music heard in the overseas releases of this film (for example, Monster from a Prehistoric Planet in the U.S.) were from an earlier film also scored by Seitaro Omori, the Nikkatsu teen drama/comedy film Youth Song (1959).

4281.name: Mardock Scramble: The First Compression
4281.storyline: Followed by Mardock Scramble: The Second Combustion (2011)

4282.name: Gamera vs. Jiger
4282.storyline: Interestingly, during Expo 70 there was a stage show featuring Gamera alongside his box office rival Godzilla. This turned out to be the closest the two ever got to having the long awaited encounter between each other. No footage, except for a few seconds of Godzilla walking with Gyaos, of the even exist.

4283.name: Starcrossed
4283.storyline: Mary: I don't know why you're willing to do this.Joey Callaghan: Because where you come from, you know, Freedom is not a tune you whistle, you know. But believe me ah, when I say this to you, that once you learn that tune, there's nobody, not anybody, that can take that away from you. Does that make sense?

4284.name: Adbhutham
4284.storyline: It is a great movie to watch but when you complete the film the story kinda feels like movie KIMI NO NAWA (Your Name) movie. Actually it deserves 9 but it went to 7 just because i felt like it is some kinda copied from it. Not entirely Kimi no nawa is entirely different story but some stuff match with both the movies. It is a great movie to watch but you should try to watch kimi no nawa too. Then you can understand where the similarities came.

4285.name: War Between the Planets
4285.storyline: The third film in the Gamma One quadrilogy was titled Il pianeta errante (The Errant Planet) in its original Italian. The english dubbed release in America was retitled War Between the Planets (WBP). Director Magheriti's economizing continued. Sets, costumes and props were reused from the first two movies, but the cast was different.

4287.name: Permafrost
4287.storyline: The snow storms in PERMAFROST are all real blizzards that happened during the filming of PERMAFROST.

4288.name: Jungleground
4288.storyline: Torri Higginson, Nicole de Boer, and Anne Marie DeLuise are also together in Family Pictures (1993).

4289.name: A Rough Draft
4289.storyline: Sergey Lukyanenko: the author of the original book, in the scene when Kiril takes the metro to his parents.

4290.name: Syndrome of the Trespasser Island
4290.storyline: The movie was released on December 13th, 2005 to capitalize on King Kong (2005), which was released in the U.S. one day later on December 14, 2005.

4291.name: Female Inquisitor
4291.storyline: This is a skin flick Japanese movie with very little if any cinematic value. Likely to be shown late at night in Showtime if it was made in the USA. However in contrast to the typical skin flick in Showtime this one has minimal production investment and the actresses are not very attractive. The worst part is the ridiculous script involving a theft and the attempts from the band of robbers to recover their booty they had lost somehow. To extract the information from the snatchers, the two female leads, use their sexual power to cause such sexual ecstasy that no one can resist. Indeed, the two guys who snatch the money withstand beatings and torture but can't resist the sexual torment. There is a laughable 'special' bed where the people having sex forward intense signals enough to torture the guy wearing a head piece wired to the bed to torture him. There is an unusual torture of a woman with eels threatening to find their way into any cavity of her body by bathing the eels with sake!. There is some contorted explanation of this unique power which is a pretext to show gratuitous sex scenes. These scenes lack eroticism or any artistic value. Overall soft core trash here, in Japan or anywhere else for that matter.

4292.name: Mad Doctor of Blood Island
4292.storyline: Angelique Pettyjohn claimed that the love scene with John Ashley was not simulated.

4294.name: Ghost Warrior
4294.storyline: First American (leading) film role for famed Japanese actor/singer/martial artist Hiroshi Fujioka, best known as the star of the famous tokusatsu (Japanese special effects) superhero TV series, Kamen Rider (1971). Americans would later remember him as the video game company Sega's karate hero mascot Sanshir Segata. Among his martial arts talent, Fujioka is a real-life Bushido practitioner, which became very useful during the production of this film.

4295.name: GoBots: Battle of the Rock Lords
4295.storyline: Like other cartoons that had movies made, the "Gobots" movie was a box office flop.

4296.name: Black Lightning
4296.storyline: This was the first Russian Superhero film ever made.

4298.name: The Groundstar Conspiracy
4298.storyline: Some scenes were shot at Simon Fraser University, at the top of Burnaby Mountain outside of Vancouver, BC. Although Vancouver attracts frequent film business today, in 1972 this film was a bit unusual for being shot in what would become known as "Hollywood North."

4299.name: Realive
4299.storyline: The protagonist reminisces about a movie he'd seen, in which Lazarus resents being brought back to life by Jesus. For this flashback, the movie uses a clip from the 1988 film "The Last Temptation of Christ," starring Willem Dafoe. Later, during the fundraising scene at the garden party, Dafoe can be spotted in a cameo as one of the applauding patrons.

4300.name: The Dustwalker
4300.storyline: Filmed in Cue, Western Australia, 620 km north-east of Perth.

4301.name: Peterchens Mondfahrt
4301.storyline: The children's book upon which this film is based was written in 1915. The cannibalism aspect of the book's plot does not feature in the movie.

4302.name: Assignment Terror
4302.storyline: Filming was interrupted due to financial difficulties, and because of that the script was not filmed as written. Whole segments of the script involving flying saucers and a Golem were never carried out, as the result of sorely lacking funds.

4303.name: Invisible Invaders
4303.storyline: Due to the film's meager budget, cast members had to perform their own stunts with little preparation or training. According to Robert Hutton, this almost led to disaster at least once during the shoot. John Agar very nearly overturned a jeep carrying himself and Hutton during a scene in which he was instructed to brake and swerve sharply. The jeep tilted onto two wheels and very nearly toppled over with the actors inside.

4304.name: For All Time
4304.storyline: This movie is based on the Rod Serling's Twilight Zone "A Stop at Willoughby"

4305.name: Black Ops
4305.storyline: Setting is a civil war in an overseas location, British Special Ops team dispatched on a mission. The military vehicles at the campsite belonging to the opposing faction are displaying UK licence plates.

4306.name: Snake Outta Compton
4306.storyline: Despite the films title, there is no relation to the former rap group NWA.

4307.name: Eyes Behind the Stars
4307.storyline: For the English-language version, another actor dubbed in the voice for Martin Balsam's character (even though Balsam was quite obviously speaking English in the film).

4308.name: C.H.O.M.P.S.
4308.storyline: This film was the first of a proposed nine-picture deal between Hanna-Barbera and American International Pictures. Joseph Barbera approached his friend Samuel Z. Arkoff about producing live-action films, although William Hanna and other people at Hanna-Barbera weren't eager to venture outside animation. Arkoff was enthusiastic about Barbera's ideas. The deal was canceled due to creative differences and this film's poor box-office performance.

4309.name: Man with the Screaming Brain
4309.storyline: After the film bombed, Bruce Campbell bought thousands of the unsold VHS copies in bulk and used them as insulation in his house.

4310.name: Panther Girl of the Kongo
4310.storyline: Evidentally stock film from Jungle Girl (1941) is used in this chapter play, notably the elephant, Panther Girl diving into the lake/river and Panther Girl dressed in a lion costume fighting a lion.

4311.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: NT - Narrative
4311.storyline: Followed by Mobile Suit Gundam: Hathaway (2021)

4313.name: Nice Girls Don't Explode
4313.storyline: April Flowers: Well, how could you tell me such incredible lies? How could you do such terrible things to me? How could you destroy my life?Mom: I'm your mother.

4314.name: Attack of the Eye Creatures
4314.storyline: Originally titled "The Eye Creatures," the studio decided to rename the film "Attack of the Eye Creatures." However, when the title card was re-done to add "Attack of the" and then re-shot to edit it into the film, it was discovered that an additional "the" had been added, thus making the film's title "Attack of the The Eye Creatures."

4315.name: The Big Space Travel
4315.storyline: Referenced in Kremlyovskiy koncert: Zhirinovskiy I Bush (2003)

4316.name: Spider-Man: Rise of a Legacy
4316.storyline: I have seen all of Six Side Studios' Fan Films & I can guarantee you that Spider-Man: Rise Of A Legacy is their best one yet. Its got a villain that we rarely see & the acting & the soundtrack is great. Mark Ricci is getting better & better at his role as he does more & more movies. This is a great fan film & a great way to spend an hour!

4317.name: Very Close Encounters of the Fourth Kind

4318.name: Escape from Area 51
4318.storyline: Frankie Sixx makes her film debut in Escape From Area 51. She is the daughter of the films star Donna D'Errico (Baywatch) and Motley Crue founder/rock star Nikki Sixx.

4319.name: Disco Raja
4319.storyline: This movie is Raviteja's first science fiction movie which is directed by V.I.Aanand

4320.name: The Treasure Planet
4320.storyline: The first full-length animated feature film in Bulgaria.

4321.name: Piranha Sharks
4321.storyline: This movie is part of the notorious german "SchleFaZ" series. Thus, it was aired December 2023 on german TV station Tele5. ("SchleFaZ" is a german abbreviation, means "the worst films ever". In the series 2 hosts present the whole flick, dress up like the main characters and discuss the overwhelming incompetence of those involved. Great fun.Hilfreic

4322.name: The Hidden Hand: Alien Contact and the Government Cover-Up
4322.storyline: References Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977)

4323.name: Enhanced
4323.storyline: Several times characters refer to the commander of the army unit as "Captain" despite his uniform having a General's star on the collar.

4324.name: Socket
4324.storyline: Writer/producer/director Sean Abley's direction to actor Matthew Montgomery upon seeing his lover's wrist socket was to "react like you're seeing the biggest cock you've ever seen!".

4326.name: Captive Wild Woman
4326.storyline: Milburn Stone, generally used by Universal as a supporting player, played the lead because his wiry frame and naturally curly hair matched the archival shots of Clyde Beatty used as Fred Mason, Stone's character.

4327.name: Supermen Dnyor
4327.storyline: Filmed without sound, all the actors were dubbed with different people.

4328.name: Condorito: The Movie
4328.storyline: The original dub was done in Mexico for Latin-American audiences, but there's also a dub done in Chile for Chilean audiences. Of all the actors, Cristin de la Fuente and Coco Legrand are the only ones who voice their respective characters in both versions.

4329.name: Return of the Ghostbusters
4329.storyline: This film was made on a budget of around $3,000.00, and took over eight months to shoot. Two CGI artists worked for another eighteen months to complete the film's more than 200 effects shots.

4330.name: Gorath
4330.storyline: Originally, the film wasn't going to include the giant walrus Magma. However, producer Tomoyuki Tanaka insisted that the monster be put into the film and forced director Ishir Honda to include it despite him being against it.

4331.name: The Mysterious Island of Captain Nemo
4331.storyline: Top-billed Omar Sharif's screen time does not exceed 22 minutes of the feature.

4334.name: White Sky
4334.storyline: Seems to be filmed on a phone most of the time, with some graphics added from a video game or something. The story is just about some people camping. If you're expecting something like Red Dawn you'll be disappointed. This is more like Blair Witch, without the witch, without the scares.It's a vanity project by the unpaid actors so that they can get noticed for something else. Nothing more.

4335.name: Oke Oka Jeevitham
4335.storyline: Nicely conceived, beautifully written and made. Time travel made in a simple and sweet way. Nice to see Amala Akhineni in a movie after a long time. Nice choice as the mother. She seems as pure as she always was.The whole cast has acted well. Perfect cinematography, very good music. Very realistic as well as engrossing movie that pulls your emotions too.Some of the movies made nowadays are gangster stuff or silly heroic nonsense. Here is a good film you feel nice after watching. Thanks to the creators.More people need to watch this so that makers are encouraged to do more good films that all can see.

4336.name: Alien Avengers
4336.storyline: The house used for Joseph's home is also used in Project Viper (2002).

4337.name: Forever
4337.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

4338.name: Gunhed
4338.storyline: The concept for the film came from a story contest that Toho held in 1986, which was to decide on the narrative for the next installment in the Godzilla series. Jim Bannon was the contestant who was noted for his Godzilla 2 script, which had Godzilla facing off against a giant computer, but was beat out by Shinichiro Kobayashi with his early draft for Godzilla vs. Biollante. However, Toho didn't scrap Bannon's second place entry, but instead had Masato Harada heavily rework the idea, removing Godzilla and other elements from the film, until they were left with the final product: the infamous Gunhed.

4339.name: Babylon 5: A Call to Arms
4339.storyline: According to Babylon 5 canon, the original Drakh plan had been to use the Death Cloud on Earth, and then use the plague on Minbar. However, when the Death Cloud was destroyed, the plague was the only significant weapon they had left.

4341.name: Doraemon: Nobita's Secret Gadget Museum
4341.storyline: It is the 33rd movie in Doraemon movie series.

4342.name: I Love You, I Love You
4342.storyline: Claude Ridder: Catherine. Catherine... I love you. Do you hear me? I love you. It was the only reason. Long before you die. And now I'm dead. I'm cold. I hear my words. It's the drug... How likely I'll survive? Oh yeah, 100% if I were a rat. Then I'm a rat, because I'm alive. Now see... anyway still have to wait four minutes. And the rat? Where is the rat?

4343.name: Doraemon the Movie: Nobita's Sky Utopia
4343.storyline: ParadisePerformed by NiziULyrics by Akira, Bang Chan (3RACHA), Seo Changbin (3RACHA) & Han (3RACHA)Music by Bang Chan (3RACHA), Seo Changbin (3RACHA) & Han (3RACHA) & VersachoiArranged by Versachoi, Bang Chan (3RACHA)Courtesy of Sony Music Labels

4344.name: The Coneheads
4344.storyline: The back of throne in opening scene is a silhouette of a nude woman's body.

4345.name: Snakehead Terror
4345.storyline: Has striking similarities to the independent film Night of the Snakehead Fish (2003), released a year earlier.

4346.name: The Hunt for the Hidden Relic
4346.storyline: One of the two helicopters on the chase near the end, the white and orange one, has a Spanish registration number: EC-FJA. Just some months after the release of the movie, this helicopter suffered an accident while performing fire-fighting tasks. Fortuntelly, all 7 on board escaped unharmed, but the main rotor caught fire and the whole aircraft was destroyed on this new fire.

4347.name: You Are Not Alone
4347.storyline: Edited from Le soleil se lve en retard (1977)

4349.name: War of the Worlds: Annihilation
4349.storyline: The military members in the back of the truck near the beginning are wearing several different types of camouflage, and one of them is carrying a Steyr AUG, a weapon not carried by the US Military.

4350.name: Doraemon: Nobita's Version of Saiyuki
4350.storyline: It is loosely based on the novel Journey to the West,is one of the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature.

4351.name: Frankenstein
4351.storyline: Patrick Bergin broke his arm during shooting.

4352.name: Mars Needs Women
4352.storyline: Tommy Kirk previously played a Martian in Pajama Party (1964), a spin-off of the Frankie Avalon-Annette Funicello Beach Party series. Yvonne Craig appeared in Ski Party (1965), another branch of that series.

4353.name: Spider in the Attic
4353.storyline: October the 24th, 2014 fell on a Friday.

4355.name: Timeless
4355.storyline: As with most of Tuschinski's films, both Matthias Kirste and Alexander Tuschinski receive credit as cinematographer. Most scenes are filmed with two cameras, with each of them operating one camera. In the single-camera sequences, they work as in their previous collaborations: When Tuschinski acts, Kirste operates the camera - and when Tuschinski doesn't appear in the shot, he operates the camera himself.

4356.name: The People Who Own the Dark
4356.storyline: The English dubbed version released in the United States as "The People Who Own the Dark" had a replacement score that included music cues from "The Blob" (1958).

4357.name: The Soul
4357.storyline: One-of-a-kind Chinese sci-fi that sets itself apart by combining Chinese tradition, belief, science, love and crime. The solemn mood, use of color, futuristic setting are all gutsy attempts by the director, and somehow it works. Even more difficult is combining the protagonists' own love story with the main flow of the film. The casts were also chosen correctly, as a film like this, especially in the Asian market must be led by more "serious" actors. The ending to me is a little questionable, while it makes sense, but seems a bit out of character as well. Nevertheless, an impressive accomplishment of piecing together a believable future. Love the analogy of this science to Chinese concept of "soul", there seems to be a lot more than what meets the eye to this film.

4358.name: Fish Story
4358.storyline: The song 'Fish Story' is an improvisation on the key riff in the song 'New Rose' by The Damned. This was the first 'punk' single released in the UK. The film sets the recording of 'Fish Story' in 1975. 'New Rose' was released in October 1976.

4360.name: BTTF Project 85: The Back to the Future Fan Remake
4360.storyline: In the early stages of the project, Ariel Turobiner and Poppy Kampalis had talked about making the film a live action recreation of Back to the Future: The Video Game by Telltale Games.

4361.name: Death House
4361.storyline: According to John Saxon, he enthusiastically offered to direct the film if he agreed to also star in it after the initially hired director withdrew from the project at the last minute. Unfortunately, the producers imposed more car chases and gore than the script asked for and Saxon later admitted he did not really get the chance to make the film according to his own vision.

4362.name: Karate Cop
4362.storyline: Ronald L. Marchini survived a drive-by shooting during production. Following a day of filming, Marchini and his wife were walking in Grupe Park (Stockton, California) when a car pulled up to the couple and both were shot at from the backseat by an unknown individual. Neither were injured.

4363.name: Doraemon: Nobita and the Animal Planet
4363.storyline: The movie premiered in india on disney channel on 17th June 2018 28 years after the original release

4364.name: Blue Demon
4364.storyline: The demon depicted in the film actually has a much larger head and is more purple.

4368.name: Invaders from Space
4368.storyline: In the original serial, the aliens are described as being the kappa, a creature from Japanese mythology. In the condensed American version, the aliens are instead referred to as "salamander men".

4369.name: King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
4369.storyline: The movie will be released on May 2nd, 2017 to capitalize on King Arthur: Legend of the Sword (2017), which will be released on May 12th, 2017.

4370.name: L.O.L. Surprise: The Movie
4370.storyline: Rebels Of The RunwayWritten by Charity Daw and Josh Edmondson

4372.name: Second Origin
4372.storyline: Based on the legendary novel by Manuel de Pedrolo "Mecanoscrit del Segon Origen", the most famous science-fiction novel in Catalan literature.

4373.name: Future Hunters
4373.storyline: The credits list Bruce Li as appearing in the film, but it is actually Bruce Le (a different Bruce Lee impersonator) who plays Liu. Bruce Li does not appear in the movie.

4374.name: Warning from Space
4374.storyline: The enormous popularity of Toho's giant monster films led Daiei to issue publicity stills showing the Pairans as gigantic creatures that towered over buildings. In the film, the Pairans are human sized.

4375.name: The Woman Eater
4375.storyline: Promotional material released by Columbia in the United States gave the title of this film as "The Woman Eater." The title on the film itself is simply "Womaneater."

4378.name: Different
4378.storyline: Arun Rampal made Special appearance in the song "Sabse Alag" in this movie

4380.name: Night of the Skinwalkers
4380.storyline: 0% chance that any of the ratings higher than a 2 are legit.Every aspect of this movie is absolute bottom of gutter trash.Acting: Elementary School Plays have better.Writing: Nothing but inane chatter that has nothing to do with anything.Story: *WHAT STORY?!?* It's just a bunch of morons sitting around chatting.Filming: They randomly go in at weird angles, with characters off to one side as the camera focuses on nothing... or they zoom in so that only about 1/3rd of the face of the character talking is in frame...CGI: ABYSMAL. They do some scenes where they are driving... I've simply never seen worse.Directing: ? Just doesn't exist.Characters: Shallow caricatures of stereotypes.Absolutely nothing about this "movie" was of even a "barely passable" level. They wouldn't pass film school with trash like this.

4381.name: The Snow Creature
4381.storyline: This low-budget release is believed to be the first American film about the Yeti, although another film featuring a Yeti-like snowman, Pekka ja Ptk lumimiehen jljill (1954), was released four months earlier.

4382.name: The Phone
4382.storyline: First, such an unfair called 'fantasy' movie. This movie looks more like well mixed realistic and surreal. Characters get confused when suspicious things happen. The bad guy's line represents it 'this is nonsense but it make sense'. I think this point of view makes The Phone stronger. Second, the tricks were fresh. Most of time-reaction plot works were copycat, but the phone gently refuse those mistake. In police station sequence, smart presentation of time-reaction with a single notepad. Brilliant. Decent watch for whole two hours. Screenplay guy and the crew made it well done. Tracing sequence in lantern march was stunning, and the lawyer's house looks beautiful. Fine work. Recommended. Watched via Brussels International Fantastic Film Festival 2016.

4383.name: First Man Into Space
4383.storyline: The pilot in the stock footage sequences is Chuck Yeager.

4384.name: Dragon Fury
4384.storyline: Followed by Dragon Fury: Wrath of Fire (2022)

4385.name: The Last Hope
4385.storyline: We've rounded up every anime series and movie we could find  created or distributed by Netflix  to see which ones rank the highest, according to IMDb users.

4388.name: From Hell It Came
4388.storyline: Stan Lee got the idea for Groot from this movie.

4389.name: Alien Predator
4389.storyline: The movie is being released on September 11th, 2018 to capitalize on 'The Predator', which is being released on September 14th, 2018.

4390.name: Star Crystal
4390.storyline: During several exterior scenes of the space station, the top half of a toy Millennium Falcon spaceship from Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977) is used as part of the exterior topography of the station.

4391.name: Pokmon the Movie: Genesect and the Legend Awakened
4391.storyline: This movie features a total of six talking Pokmon, more than any previous movie. In the process, this number surpasses the record of five from Pokmon the Movie: Kyurem vs. the Sword of Justice (2012).

4392.name: The Midnight After
4392.storyline: The movie features David Bowie's song "Space Oddity".

4393.name: The Flying Saucer
4393.storyline: Mike is a chain smoker as he is seen smoking or lighting a cigarette in virtually every scene in this movie.

4397.name: The Man Who Could Work Miracles
4397.storyline: Torin Thatcher, George Sanders, and Ivan Brandt are Celestial Bodies who appear at the beginning and end of this movie.

4398.name: Dasavatharam
4398.storyline: The score for song "Ulaga Nayagan" was copied from the song "Why Does It Happen in Love?" from Dil Maange More!!! (2004), which also had music by Himesh Reshammiya.

4399.name: Campus Code
4399.storyline: The director is the daughter of Martin Scorsese, who took a role in the movie. As did Scorsese's lead actor from Goodfellas, Ray Liotta.

4400.name: Deep Freeze
4400.storyline: All the exterior shots of the Antarctic facility and helicopter is footage taken from John Carpenter's The Thing.

4401.name: Zaman Makinesi 1973
4401.storyline: The car turned out to be the time machine in the movie is an Anadol STC-16, first Turkish made sports car designed and produced by Otosan between 1973-75.

4402.name: The Rodriguez and the Beyond
4402.storyline: A couple and their children must learn how to control their newfound superpowers. The father turns on as a light bulb, the older daughter has super-strength, the younger daughter is capable of being invisible, the grandmother floats and the son is super-intelligent. Definitely this family is from another world.I really loved these superheroes, super unlikely, this Spanish comedy is extremely fun, the characters are very captivating, the photography is very colorful, vibrant colors, in harmony with the very fun characters, even the supporting actors and agile, simple and fun scripts... Not certain comedies, but it's the top of light and naive humor that I like...

4403.name: Ghost Project
4403.storyline: This movie was made by nobodies and first-timers, on obviously no budget. For that it's actually quite good. Yes it's rough around the edges. But then it's a horror movie so it doesn't really have to make perfect sense.As for the plot: Young techie types find old hardware that can make ghosts visible. Ghosts don't appreciate that very much. Bring in burned-down place with plenty of ghosts in it and go for it.It's certainly on par with other horror movies that don't quite work despite having 100 times the budget and big names attached to them. Ghost Project's makers' next project will be much more polished and it's a workable first effort to be honest.
