4899.storyline: Two of the creatures that Willy Meyers (Benjamin Easterday) states the soldiers are trained for are Mansquito and Sand Sharks. Corin Nemec, the other soldier in the scene, starred in the movies featuring these creatures - although he played other characters. Sand Sharks (2011) was also produced by Little Dragon Productions, who produced Dragon Wasps. Benjamin Easterday and Corin Nemec team up again in Dracano (2013)

4900.name: Psychophonia
4900.storyline: This movie is dedicated to Daniel Quinn who played Detective Alex Becker in this film. He passed away July 4, 2015 (age 58).

4901.name: Blue Gender: The Warrior
4901.storyline: This movie is a remake of the TV series with new footage.

4902.name: Tinker'
4902.storyline: Clayne Crawford was a guest star on Leverage, which featured Christian Kane.

4904.name: Future '38
4904.storyline: On the wall at the Keystone is an "old" newspaper story that says the Brooklyn Dodgers won the 1986 World Series. The subtitle of the article reads, "Dodgers Will be in NYC Forever, Vow Owners." In reality, the Dodgers moved to Los Angeles in 1958, and the New York Mets, from Brooklyn's neighboring borough of Queens, won the 1986 World Series defeating the Boston Red Sox 4-3.

4907.name: Love and Time Travel
4907.storyline: The inspiration for this movie for director Hayden J. Weal was the idea of taking the time to get to know the people around you. He told Stuff website: "I feel like we don't interact or feel things for people we see every day as much as we used to. Like, when I was a kid [in Te Awamutu], I'd talk to people on the school bus, you know, you would kind of get to know everyone around you. But now, people don't talk to each other on public transport, or they barely know the people they work with and see every day, people like security guards and receptionists and things.''

4909.name: Head on a Plate
4909.storyline: I was horrified to see the low score assigned to this film.There was real creativity and intention involved. The film took its time. How often do actors dress the part! How often does the camera allow the time to appreciate and enjoy.We have distinct characters here, revealed more by observation than dialogue. I was impressed by the hungry nurse and her disordered patients.Gory in some places. Does the film try to corrupt us into perversions of decapitation ands cannibalism.Good use of sound and colour. Bold film making.Distinct and original.I found the leading actress very appealing and challenging. She reminded me of Donatella Versace. I also enjoyed the Gothic human character.

4910.name: Badi
4910.storyline: The film is also known as "Duckling" in some places.

4911.name: N.I.M.: Inteligencia Artificial
4911.storyline: This movie was launched due to the delay of other projects due to the Coronavirus pandemic.

4912.name: The Vengeance of Doctor Mabuse
4912.storyline: Though mainly a German Production, the film was never released theatrically or on Video / DVD in Germany but was aired on Television a few times in the 90s.

4913.name: III Slices of Life
4913.storyline: In the story "Amber Alert, when Vonda walks out of her house to follow the missing girl Abby, she is seen barefoot, but once she's outside, she is seen wearing sneakers.

4914.name: G-Loc
4914.storyline: When Bran's escape pod rushes towards the Nysa, Edison counts up the acceleration rate to G-6 before telling Bran to flip the ship to decelerate. Edison then counts backwards, G-6, G-5, G-4, etc. That's not how it works in space. Once the ship got near the halfway point, it would stop accelerating and the G-force would instantly go to zero. After the ship flipped the retro rocket would have to again decelerate to a G-6 level to stop the ship at the destination. Thus, the G-forces would go up from zero to 6, not down as depicted.

4915.name: Prototype
4915.storyline: Was featured in an episode of Red Letter Media's 'Best of the Worst' youtube show.

4916.name: How to Make a Monster
4916.storyline: In the film, there's a poster of the video game Evil Dead: Hail to the King (2000), and a pinball machine of Tales from the Crypt (1989).

4918.name: Shark Week
4918.storyline: The film title is A.K.A. 'Shark Assault'.

4919.name: Planet of the Female Invaders
4919.storyline: Solid example of the time-honored 1950s sub-genre featuring planets inhabited by only 20-something pretty women. Others include Catwomen of the Moon, Abbott and Costello Go to Mars, Missile to the Moon, and Queen of Outer Space. PIW offers no reason why there are only pretty young women on the planet. It's just a scientific fact.

4920.name: Taisu Xilie
4920.storyline: Edited from A Girl Meets a Boy and a Robot (2022)

4921.name: De film van Dylan Haegens
4921.storyline: The first official trailer for this movie was released on July 1 2018. This trailer received over 350.000 views within a day. Herewith it broke the record for the most amount of views in 24 hours for a Dutch film trailer ever.

4922.name: Ga-ga: Glory to the Heroes
4922.storyline: I recently purchased the set of director Piotr Szulkin's science fiction films that was put out on blu-ray by Vinegar Syndrome. I was hesitant since I had not cared much for the one Szulkin film I had seen (The Golem), but overall, I liked the set. I enjoyed O-bi, O-ba: The End of Civilization the best of the four films, but I also liked Ga-ga: Glory to the Heroes.In a totalitarian future, prisoners are used as space explorers. Scope, the protagonist, is sent to a planet that is very similar to earth. Here, his landing is both expected and hailed. He is proclaimed as a hero and can have anything he wants. However, there is a pretty big catch involved.The world Scope finds himself in is an ugly, cheap one, one whose citizens crave entertainment, and the government bureaucracy gives it to them, through the country's "heroes." All of this is conveyed in a darkly humorous, satirical manner. This humor could be hit and miss at times. I got tired of the cannibal jokes, but other jokes hit. What I liked most how the film was able to convey a futuristic world with almost no special effects.Ga, Ga: Glory to the Heroes is worth checking out for the more adventurous science-fiction fan.

4923.name: Fearless
4923.storyline: The final film from 3QU Media, but the second to be released in the United States.

4924.name: The Jimmy Timmy Power Hour
4924.storyline: This is Nickelodeon's fourth crossover between two of its shows (the first three being Rugrats (1991)/Aaahh!!! Real Monsters (1994), Kenan & Kel (1996)/Cousin Skeeter (1998), and Rugrats (1991)/The Wild Thornberrys (1998)).

4925.name: Prophecies of Nostradamus
4925.storyline: Since this was a full-scale production, Toho required the use of all of their own visual effects soundstages. However, during filming of a special effects scene, a pyrotechnical accident caused a fire that burned down part of the main visual effects soundstage, an incident that was very widely reported in Japan at the time. The fire destroyed a number of costumes and props from earlier Toho tokusatsu classics that were kept in storage at the time, including the original Mogera costume from The Mysterians (1957).

4926.name: The Mutation
4926.storyline: The movie is obviously made in the UK, with changing accents from the actors throughout, but it is supposedly set in the US. During an item on the news, however, the headline reads 'Mutated Rat seen in English countryside'.

4927.name: The 11th Green
4927.storyline: The President: Us? I mean, you're not even... 'physiologically incarnate' at this point.Lars: Neither am I. And yet our concern has never been greater. And our love.

4928.name: The Alternate
4928.storyline: At 1:07:17 when Jake closes the car door, a reflection of the mike is visible in the car window.

4929.name: The Corridor
4929.storyline: I became awakePerformed by Great Lake SwimmersWritten by Tony DekkerPublished by  2007 T.Dekker/Harbour Songs(Socan)Courtesy of Nettwerk Music Group

4930.name: The Frozen Dead
4930.storyline: Although the film was both shot and released in UK theaters and on U.S. TV in color, the U.S. theatrical release prints of it were released in black-and-white in order to save the distributor money on duplicating prints.

4931.name: Mandroid
4931.storyline: Was originally set to be made in 1986 by Charles Band's previous studio Empire Pictures under the name of "Mindmaster." Jack Kirby was also attached to the project.

4932.name: Stonehenge Apocalypse
4932.storyline: A version of the word "electromagnetic" is said 26 times throughout the movie.

4933.name: Remains
4933.storyline: In the release poster for the movie showing a decaying thumb holding a hand of cards, the hand is black aces and eights, with an unknown 5th card, Known in the poker playing world as, 'The dead mans hand.' This infamous poker hand is attributed to the final set of cards that lawman and old west hero Wild Bill Hickok held when he was assassinated in 1876.

4934.name: I Love Maria
4934.storyline: The robot designs for Maria seem heavily influenced by the 80's robot art of Hajime Sorayama.

4935.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
4935.storyline: Pilot for a TV series that was never picked up for a full season.

4936.name: Cinco
4936.storyline: In the trailer, the 2004 Star Cinema/ABS-CBN Film Productions logo is zoomed out, that is very similar to the trailer variant used in Sukob (2006) and it is in dark brown. the actual film and TV spots meanwhile had the logo with the curve drawing and the star appearing before the texts fade in and appears in the dark red background.

4937.name: The Call Up
4937.storyline: The way the body armour and hit points work is very similar to the ghouls and ghosts gaming series

4938.name: Dead Again
4938.storyline: Steven M. Smith previously worked with Tony Fadil in such films as The Howling (2017) and Borstal (2017).

4939.name: Partner
4939.storyline: Aalana VathikuchiWritten by KabilanPerformed by Neeti Mohan

4940.name: Harmony
4940.storyline: Originally slated to be released on December 4, 2015 but delays with the companion film, Genocidal Organ (2017) release had to be bumped up to November 13.

4941.name: Mobile Suit Gundam III: Encounters in Space
4941.storyline: Unlike Mobile Suit Gundam I (1981), which was edited entirely from existing episodes and Mobile Suit Gundam II: Soldiers of Sorrow (1981), which uses at least 30% of new animation; this adaption uses at least 70% of new animation.

4942.name: Sirona
4942.storyline: Sirona is filmed entirely in Colorado and all of the cast and crew are from Colorado

4943.name: Errors of the Human Body
4943.storyline: Jarek Novak: You know, mosquitoes, bed bugs, fleas, ticks - they all carry disease, yes? But instead of spreading sickness, why not change the formula. Make them carry genetically modified viruses? Anti-genes to our own plan. Imagine using this in the Third World; in Africa. They're going to be bitten anyway. Why not let them catch the "malaria vaccine", instead?Geoffrey Burton: Hmm. But then you would first have to invent a "malaria vaccine", right?Jarek Novak: You don't think it's possible?Geoffrey Burton: I didn't say that.Jarek Novak: You know Stalin, Mao Zedong...Geoffrey Burton: Only by reputation.Jarek Novak: Both of them believed they could transform ideology by breeding one indoctrinated generation to the next, and eventually you would get genetically programmed communists.

4944.name: Doraemon: Nobita's Dorabian Nights
4944.storyline: This was the 4th grossing animated film of 1991 (making $18,000,000), behind Studio Ghibli's Only Yesterday, Amblimation's Fievel Goes West and, obviously, Disney's Beauty and The Beast.

4945.name: Adela Has Not Had Supper Yet
4945.storyline: Carnivorous plant named Adela was not a prop, but real plant (though not, of course, carnivorous). A specialist from a local university was required to take care about the plant during the filming.

4948.name: The Lucifer Complex
4948.storyline: Filmed in 1976 but never released to theaters, going directly to TV in 1978.

4949.name: Moon Pilot
4949.storyline: Film debut of Sally Field and Jo Anne Worley,

4951.name: Moonbase
4951.storyline: The space prison guards wear East German army uniforms and rank insignia.

4952.name: Forbidden Planet
4952.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

4953.name: Logan's Run
4953.storyline: When the project was in development in 2000, Leonardo DiCaprio was once slated to play Logan.

4954.name: The Monitors
4954.storyline: The shot of the topless redhead in the cemetery that briefly appears in the montage after Barbara asks Harry what he is thinking about (when they are getting into the plane) is from Ed Wood's softcore 'horror' film 'Orgy of the Dead' (1965).

4955.name: Sensation
4955.storyline: Staz Nair was originally supposed to play the role of Andrew Cooper. Nair, just like Eugene Simon, starred in the HBO show Game of Thrones.

4956.name: They Saved Hitler's Brain
4956.storyline: This film, despite bearing a 1963 copyright date, was actually released five years later in 1968. The original theatrical version of the film, The Madmen of Mandoras (1963), was combined with new footage of "CID" agents Vic and Toni shot entirely for the new version of the film, which was released to television and retitled "They Saved Hitler's Brain". The Vic and Toni footage was obviously shot five years later, because the hairstyles and fashions seen in them did not become popular until the late 1960s.

4957.name: Repeat
4957.storyline: Tom England and Joshua Ford previously starred together in COSMOS.

4958.name: Pig
4958.storyline: Final film of Sarah Danielle Madison.

4959.name: The Astral Factor
4959.storyline: Being a film of mostly former A-list guest stars like Sue Lyon and Elke Sommer, character-actor Frank Ashmore, who plays the central killer/antagonist, is far down in the credits. In fact, his name shows up in the middle of a "stack" of names. This could be because he was one of the few unknown actors in this film, or the fact he's invisible a lot of the time.

4962.name: Supersonic Man
4962.storyline: Part of the spaceship in the opening scenes is made from a Cylon Raider model.

4963.name: Flora
4963.storyline: The Morse Code (...---...) which opens the film spells SOS. The remainder of the message is revealed at 35:00.

4964.name: Macross Frontier: The False Songstress
4964.storyline: Followed by Macross Frontier: The Wings of Farewell (2011)

4965.name: The Snow Queen
4965.storyline: If people milling about in a snowy forest for ages is your idea of the a good time then watch this bad boy. Otherwise just turn it off after 20m or so for your fill of snow covered woods.Not much else to say, the voice-overs are a bad facsimile for acting. The woods are a bad substitute for a set, and whatever the plot was couldn't really be close to resembling a story.There's not much more to say but there's a minimum character requirement so here's some movies you can watch instead if you want fantasy:Anything from the Mythica movies.Dudes and Dragons on TUBI.Classics like Conan, you know it.

4966.name: Chemical Wedding
4966.storyline: Christina Chong and Gemma Hiles's debut.

4967.name: The Black Knight Returns
4967.storyline: Re: The main ending fight between The Black Knight and Simon Darth. The beginning portion of the fight is edited with the ending portion of the fight. The confrontation is never cut to let the choreography build. The beginning having taken place in one part of the location, and ending on a different side of the location. What is seen in the final edit is everything mashed together in one poorly edited showdown.

4968.name: Mutant Species
4968.storyline: David A. Prior originally wanted Arnold Schwarzenegger as Lt. Hollinger, Jean-Claude Van Damme as Trotter, Michael Ironside as Frost, Dee Wallace Stone as Carol-Anne, and Bill Duke as McCall. However the studio felt they would cost too much, so they settled with a lower rent cast.

4969.name: The War of the Planets
4969.storyline: This is the second film in the Gamma-One series and follows Wild, Wild Planet (a.k.a. I Criminali della Galassia ("Criminals of the Galaxy")) and precedes War Between the Planets (a.k.a. Il Pianeta Errante ("Planet on the Prowl")) and Snow Devils (a.k.a. La Morte Viene dal Pianeta Aytin ("Death Comes From The Planet Aytin")).

4970.name: Cyst
4970.storyline: Dr Guy Throws a scalpel through patty's arm but she never bleeds.

4971.name: Path of Destruction
4971.storyline: Blackhawk helicopters have a main rotor and a tail rotor. They require both rotors to fly. The helicopter pilot states that the helicopter lost one of its rotors; yet the aircraft continues flying.

4973.name: The Grim Adventures of the KND
4973.storyline: Other shows that make references or appearances are: Ed Edd N Eddy, Powerpuff Girls, Camp Lazlo, My Gym Partner is a Monkey, Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends, Scooby-Doo, Dexter's Laboratory, Class of 3000.

4975.name: 50 Kisses
4975.storyline: With 51 writers, 50 Kisses holds the official Guinness World Record for the most co-writers credited for a film.

4976.name: Cosmic Slop
4976.storyline: The title is taken from a song by George Clinton's band, Funkadelic.

4977.name: Dante 01
4977.storyline: Director Marc Caro had a different ending in mind but couldn't shoot it because the original budget of eight million Euros was cut back to four million by the producers.

4978.name: Aberration
4978.storyline: The movie Bug Buster (1998) was released in Japan as Aberration 2.

4979.name: It's Alive!
4979.storyline: This has the unusual distinction of being a remake of a movie that was never made in the first place. When American International made a deal with Larry Buchanan to remake some of their movies ("It Conquered the World" became "Zontar, the Thing from Venus," "The She-Creature" became "Creature of Destruction" and so forth), they evidently included a script based on Richard Matheson's story "Being." The production had gone by several titles, including "G.O.O.", and was to have starred Peter Lorre and Elsa Lanchester. Apparently Lorre's death canceled the project, so AIP earned back some of their money by passing the script on to Buchanan.

4980.name: Wonderful Days
4980.storyline: The island of Gibraltar is in fact Greek island Santorini (Thera), as seen in the end sequence when we see its map.

4981.name: The Mouse on the Moon
4981.storyline: Although other characters from The Mouse That Roared (1959) appeared (Prime Minister Rupert Mountjoy and his opposition leader Benter) David Kossoff (Kokintz) was the only principal cast member of The Mouse That Roared (1959) who returned to play the same role in this movie.

4982.name: Imitation Girl
4982.storyline: Lauren Ashley Carter and Brian Morvant also appeared in Darling, Pod, and The Mind's Eye.

4984.name: Murder in Space
4984.storyline: When first aired on the Showtime cable network, the ending was not shown, and cash prizes were offered to viewers who could identify the killer.

4985.name: Anatomy 2
4985.storyline: Special prize for German productions of the Curt-Siodmak-Preises 2004.

4986.name: Frogtown II
4986.storyline: Roddy Piper was too busy with his wrestling career to return for the sequel.

4987.name: Battle of the Worlds
4987.storyline: In the US this was passed over by major distributors. It was picked up by a very minor distributor and wasn't released until 1963. As a result, it received scant bookings and remained unseen theatrically in many areas. It was popular via U.S. television syndication later in the 1960s, followed in 1986 when it was widely distributed on VHS (pan and scanned) by the bargain label Goodtimes Home Video.

4989.name: Again Again
4989.storyline: Filmed in Aberdeen, Washington, hometown of the director.

4990.name: Infinite Santa 8000
4990.storyline: Body Count (Original Cut): 854. The film is 94 minutes long, so it has 9.085 kills per minute.

4992.name: Occupants
4992.storyline: There is a comic book spin off of the feature film - the 24-page comic book was successfully crowdfunded on Indiegogo in March 2016. It will be drawn by DC/Marvel Comics artist Dave Beaty.

4993.name: The Selection
4993.storyline: The first book of "The Selection" series by Kiera Cass to be adapted into a movie by Netflix.

4994.name: Intelligent Life
4994.storyline: Ava DuVernay was hired to direct but dropped out due to scheduling conflicts.

4995.name: Android Cop
4995.storyline: The film was released on February 4th, 2014 to capitalize on RoboCop (2014), which was released in the U.S. on February 12th, 2014.

4996.name: Man Beast
4996.storyline: The monster suit was originally used in the movies The White Gorilla and White Pongo, both made in 1945. Both monsters were played by actor Ray Corrigan.

4997.name: High Desert Kill
4997.storyline: A TV movie made for the USA network.

4999.name: Bang Bang Baby
4999.storyline: Justin Chatwin and Jane Levy previously starred in Shameless (2011) together.
